At this time the Commission took up the matter of providing a dump ground for the City,
and after due consideration and investigation the following Resolution was adopted.

Upon motion of Commissioner Mundy seconded by Commissioner Thomas the Resolution was
duly adopted:

RESOLVED, that the City purchase from A.W. Ham the following described real estate,
situate in the County of Clark, State of Nevada, as and for a site for City dumping ground and
other purposes, to-wit:

The Southwest Quarter (SW ) of the Southwest Quarter (SW¼) of Section one (1), Township
twenty-one (21) South, Range sixty-one (61) East Mount Diablo Base and Merdian,

for the sum of Eighteen Hundred Dollars, payable $900.00 cash down, and the balance in equal
monthly installments of $100.00, each the first installment being payable on the 5th day of
September, 1932, and a like equal installment to be payable on the 5th day of each and every
month thereafter until the full balance is due; seller to furnish a title insurance in the sum
of $1800.00 guaranteeing the property to be free from lien, cloud, encumbrance or material
defect, except as to mineral rights reserved in the original patent from the State of Nevada,
and except as to the State and County taxes for the year 1932, which latter the first parties,
sellers, shall pay and discharge promptly when due and payable and not to allow the same to be or
become delinquent; that the Mayor and City Clerk are hereby authorized on behalf of the City to
enter into a written contract on behalf of the City with said sellers, and that an escrow be
formed to hold said deed and policy of title insurance, and that form of contract be as shall be
prescribed by the City Attorney.

The vote on said Resolution was as follows: Commissioners Mundy, German, Thomas and
Hansell and His Honor the Mayor E.W.Cragin voting Aye. Noes none.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting recessed until
Thursday the 11th day of August 1932 at the hour of three o'clock P.M.

the leave ask for be granted.

Commissioners Thomas and German and His Honor the Mayor voting Aye. Commissioner
Mundy not voting. Noes none.

At this time Mayor Cragin stated to the Board of Commissioners that he wished to
re-instate Clay H. Williams as Chief of Police for the City of Las Vegas.

Clay H. Williams was then re-instated as Chief of Police of the City of Las Vegas.

At this time the resignation of Clay H. Williams as Chief of Police of the City of
Las Vegas was presented to the Board for its consideration. Same to be effective August 31st, 1932.

The Members of the Commission then entered into a discussion as to the best means for
providing for the appointing of a new chief of police and considered a number of names that had
been presented to the Board for its approval. No decision was reached on the matter at this
time and the meeting recessed until Monday the 8th day of August 1932, at the hour of 10:30 A.M.

Monday August 8th, 1932, 10:30 A.M.

The following answered roll call: Mayor Cragin, Commissioners Mundy, German, and
Thomas, City Attorney and Clerk.

Absent Commissioner Hansell.

The Board at once entered into a discussion on the matter of providing a Chief of
Police for the City of Las Vegas. After a lengthy discussion on the matter the meeting adjourned
with not definite action being taken on the matter.

Mr. A.C. Grant, appeared before the Board of Commissioners at this time on behalf of the
Chamber of Commerce of the City of Las Vegas. He explained to the Board that the City of Las Vegas
would be able to participate in the advertising of the All Year Club of California for the year
1935 if sufficient funds could be raised, and petitioned the Board of Commissioners at this
time to donate the sum of §300.00 for this purpose.

On motion of Commissioner Thomas, Seconded by Commissioner Mundy it was moved seconded and
carried that the sum of $300.00 be donated from the Publicity Fund of the City of Las Vegas to
the Chamber of Commerce to be used for advertising purposes in the "All Year Club" of California.

Vote on said motion was as follows: Commissioners Mundy, German, Thomas and Hansell and
His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes none.

An Ordinance entitled, "An Ordinance of the City Las Vegas to amend, revise add re-
enact Section 1 of Ordinance No. 92 of the City of Las Vegas, entitled 'An Ordinance of the
City of Las Vegas establishing a City Dump Ground, and regulating the removal and disposal of
rubbish, etc.' " was read for the first time and laid over for a second reading.

An Ordinance to amend, revise and re-enact Section 10a as created by Ordinance No. 184 of
the City of Las Vegas, entitled: "An Ordinance to amend Section 7 of Ordinance No. 48 of the
City of Las Vegas, entitled 'An Ordinance of the City of Las Vegas licensing for the purpose of
regulation and revenue, every kind of lawful business hereinafter specified, transacted or carried
on within the corporate limits of the City of Las Vegas, State of Nevada, fixing the rates of
license tax upon the same and providing for the collection of said license tax, and a punish-
ment for carrying on or conducting any such business without a license, and repealing Ordin-
ances Nos. 1,2,4, 13, 14, and 35, as amended by Sec. 1 of Ordinance No. 81 of said City, by
herein amending certain subdivisions thereof and by adding and by adding certain other sub-
divisions and to amend said ordinance No. 48 by adding two new sections to be known as Sections
Nos. 10a and 10b respectively, and to repeal all ordinances and parts of ordinances in con-
flict therewith," was read for a first time and laid over for a second reading.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las

Roll call showed the following present, Mayor Cragin, Commissioners German and Thomas,
City Attorney and Clerk.

Absent Commissioners Mundy and Hansell.

Upon motion of Commissioners German seconded by Commissioner Thomas, the following
Resolution was duly adopted:

Resolved, that the sum of One Hundred Dollars ($100.00) be and the same is hereby
appropriated to the Police Department of the City of Las Vegas for use in investigations to be
made by said Department , and that a warrant for said amount be drawn in favor of Lewis Hord,
Acting Chief of Police to be used for said purposes. Accounting therefor to be made on
order of this Board.

The vote on said Resolution was as follows: Commissioners German, Thomas and the
Mayor voting aye. Noes none.

The matter of the releasing of the bond of the Glens Falls Indemnity Company, surety
for the Nevada Gas Company, Ltd. was next brought before the Board for consideration.

Mr. J.P. King, Supt. of Streets for the City of Las Vegas informed the Board that the
said Nevada Gas Company, Ltd. had fulfilled all the requirements of said bond, there upon on
motion of Commissioner Thomas seconded by Commissioner German it was,

Resolved, that the bond of $2,000.00 of the Glens Falls Indemnity Co. indemnity on
the excavations of the Nevada Gas Company, Ltd; be and the same is hereby released as the said
Nevada Gas Company have fulfilled the terms of its contract which said bond covered.

Vote on said Resolution was as follows: Commissioners German, Thomas and His Honor
the Mayor E.W. Cragin voting aye. Noes none.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting then recessed
until Thursday the 25th day of August, 1932 at the hour of three o'clock P.M.

Attorney McNamee appeared before the Board of Commissioners at this time and petition-
ed the Board to vacate certain streets in the City of Las Vegas in the Tankel North Addition.

WHEREAS, an application having heretofore been filed in writing by the owners of the
land contained in the plat hereinafter described to be vacated and by the owner of all of the

land contiguous or adjacent to any street or alley in such plat to vacate which application was made, re-
questing that the portion of the plat hereinafter described be vacated, which application is
on file and of record in the Office of the City Clerk of the City of Las Vegas, Clark County,
Nevada, and which petition is hereby referred to and by reference made a part hereof, and the
Beard of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas, Clark County, Nevada, having duly considered
the same, and

WHEREAS? after due consideration the Board is satisfied that neither the public
nor any person will be materially injured by vacating said portion of said Plat, upon motion
by Commissioner German, seconded by Commissioner Hansell, it is hereby

ORDERED, that that portion of the Plat of the Tankel's North Addition to the City
of Las Vegas, Clark County, Nevada, which Plat is recorded in Book 1, of Plats, at Page 94,

Clark County, Nevada, Records, described as follows; to-wit:

The whole of said plat except:

1.	The	portion	thereof	designated	as	Croissant Street.

2.	The	portion	thereof	designated	as	Oak Street.

3.	The	portion	thereof	designated	as	DeVere Ave.

4.	The	portion	thereof	designated	as	Euclid Ave;	and

5.	That portion thereof located West of the Easterly side line of 13th Street.

be and the same is hereby vacated, as prayed for in the petition or application filed herein
as aforesaid.

A vote upon said motion having been duly taken, which resulted in Commissioners
German and Hansell and His Honor the Mayor, E.W.Cragin voting "Aye", and "Nos" none.

Upon motion of Commissioner Hansell, seconded by Commissioner Thomas it was moved that
the City of Las Vegas advertise for sale 16 (sixteen) bonds of the Las Vegas Sewerage Bond
issue. Vote on said motion was as follows: Commissioners Mundy, German, Hansell, Thomas and
His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes none.

Notice to bond bidders being in the following form;

NOTICE TO BOND BIDDERS

The Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas, Clark County, Nevada, will
receive bids until three o'clock P. M. on the 29th day of September, 1932, for the purchase
of sixteen bonds of Las Vegas Sewerage Bond issue. Said bonds will bear interest at a rate
not exceeding seven per centum per annum, payable semi-annually, and will bear date the first
day of July, 1931. Said bonds are a portion of an entire issue consisting of One Hundred
Sixty (160) bonds in the denomination of Ore Thousand Dollars ($1000.00) each, which
mature $8000.00 on the first day of July in each of the years 1933 to 1932 inclusive. The
bonds now proposed to be issued ill commence with bond No. 1 and run consecutively thereafter
up to bond No. 16 inclusive, the first maturity of eight bonds to mature on the first day of July
1934.

Each bid, except the bid of the State of Nevada, if one is received, must be accompanied by
a deposit of five per dent, either cash or certified check payable to the City Clerk of the City
of Las Vegas, of the amount of the bid, which will be returned if the bid is not accepted;
and if the successful bidder shall fail or neglect to complete the purchase of said bonds with-
in thirty days following the acceptance of his or its bid, the amount of his or its deposit
will be	forfeited to	said City	of Las Vegas, and in that	event the bid of the one making the

next best bid for the	same amount of bonds. If there be two or more equal bids for the same amount

of bonds and such bids are the best received, and not less than par and accrued interest, said
board of commissioners will determine which bid shall be accepted.

All bids must be sealed in opaque envelopes and marked "For Las Vegas Sewerage Bonds,

1931 issue," and addressed to the City Clerk of the City of Las Vegas, Las Vegas, Nevada.

Bids will be opened by s id Board of Commissioners on the 29th day of September, 1932, at the
hour of	three o'clock	P. M. at	the regular meeting place	of said Board in the Commissioners

Room in	the office of	the City	Clerk in said	City Of Las	Vegas. Bidders shall submit a bid

specifying (a) the lowest rate of interest and premium, if any, above par, at which such bidder will
purchase the specified number of bonds; or (b) the lowest rate of interest at which the bidder will
purchase the specified number of said bonds at par. The bonds will be sold to the bidder making
the best bid subject to the right of said Board of Commissioners to reject any and all bids and re-
advertise. None of said bonds will be sold at less than par and accrued interest, and no discount
or commission will be allowed or paid on the sale of such bonds.

Dated this first day of September, 1932.

Board of Commissioners of the City of

Las Vegas, Clark County, Nevada

By E. W. Cragin_______________________

Mayor

Attest:

Viola Burns

City Clerk

By Mary Taylor_________

Deputy

(City Seal)

The following letter pas presented to the board by Dr. Roy W. Martin:

Las Vegas, Nevada
September 8th, 1932

Board of City Commissioners,

Las Vegas, Nevada.

Dear Sirs:

I am planning, together with my associates, an extensive development program with
a considerable acreage south of the City of Las Vegas. As a part of this program I have
made application for a water franchise to supply this development, and have also applied
for the necessary permits from Clark County.

It has occurred to me, that although this territory is outside the city limits
of Las Vegas, it would be helpful to secure from the City Commissioners an expression
of approval of the development, and I therefore ask that a favorable endorsement be
given this request.

Respectfully yours,

(SGD) Dr. Roy W. Martin.

Upon motion of Commissioner Hansell, seconded by Commissioner German the Board did approve
the development as outlined in the above letter and ordered such approval incorporated
into the minutes of the meeting. Vote on same being as follows: Commissioners Mundy,
German, Hansell and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes none.

Upon motion of Commissioner Hansell, seconded by Commissioner german it was moved
that the Fuller Construction Company make a wet connection for turning sewage in the
new mains for the sole purpose of testing the Sewage Disposal Plant and that such use
of the mains shall not be deemed an acceptance of Main Sewers and Disposal Plant
and that this order stall in no wise change or effect terms and conditions existing
with the Fuller Construction Company. Vote on same being as follows: Commissioners
Mundy, German, Hansell and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes none.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting then
recessed untill the 9th day of September, 1932.

OFFICE OF TEE CITY CLERK, LAS VEGAS,
CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

SEPTEMBER 13th, 1932.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of
Las Vegas held on the 13th day of September 1932 at the hour of seven thirty O'clock P.M.

Roll call showed the following present, Mayor Cragin, Commissioners Mundy, German,
Thomas and Hansell and City Attorney and Clerk.

The final estimate on the contract of Fuller Construction Company on construction of
sanitary main sewers and disposal plant was presented to the Board and request made for final
payment.

The Board required that Fuller Construction Company furnish to the Board satisfactory
evidence showing that all materials, labor, machine hire, and so forth had been paid for
both by the Fuller Construction Company and subcontractors under it.

Thereupon Fuller Construction Company presented and filed with the Board the
affidavit of A.J. Reinhart, its representative, showing all such bills having been paid, and
also presented receipted vouchers for nearly all of said claims, and check stubs for various
minor claims evidence of remittance of the amounts thereof to various creditors.

Said Fuller Construction Company also filed the affidavit of L.J.Watson and Wayne D.
Baldwin, represented by it to be the only subcontractors, which affidavit showed payment by
such subcontractors of all bills for labor and materials incurred by them under such sub-
contracts.

There was also filed with the Board a maintenance bond as required by the contract
between the City of Las Vegas, and said Fuller Construction Company.

There was ales filed an order of said Fuller construction Company on said Board
dated September 10th, 1932 in favor of Pacific Clay Products, directing the payment direct to
the said Pacific Clay Products of the sum of $14,423.02 as balance due in full to said Pacific
Clay Products for materials furnished the contractor on said job.
There was also called to the attention of the Board the fact that an attachment had
heretofore been served on the City Clerk, and City Treasurer, in a suit by Fannie Ryan versus
the Fuller Construction Company, pending in the district court of the Eighth Judicial District
 of the State of Nevada, in and for the County of Clark, wherein $2,700.00 in damages
was claimed against the said Fuller Construction Company, and it was represented to the Board
by A.W. Ham, attorney for said Fuller Construction Company, that a cashier's check for $3000.
had heretofore been deposited with the Sheriff of Clark County, and made in favor of the
Fuller Construction Company, drawn by First State Bank of Las Vegas, Nevada, Inc; as indemnity
against any liability of the City under such attachment, but Mr. Ham did not know whether an
indorsement of suck Cashier's check had been made by said Fuller Construction Company.

Webster L. Benham, consulting engineer, and Mr. P.M. Green resident engineer under said
Consulting Engineer represented to the Board that the contract of said Fuller Construction
Company had been fully performed and that all bills for labor, materials, machine hire had to
the best of their knowledge been paid and discharged, and that the similar debts of subcon-
tractors had been paid and that the cleaning and leveling of streets and alleys had been made
by said contractor.

There upon on motion of Commissioner Hansell seconded by Commissioner Mundy the
following Resolution was adopted:

Resolved, that the main sanitary sewer system and disposal plant, constructed by
Fuller Construction Company, be and the same is hereby accepted, and that a warrant be drawn
in favor of said Fuller Construction Company for the amount mentioned in the final estimate,
$18,569.16, less the amounts directed to be paid direct to any other creditor including the
$14,423.02 directed to be paid Pacific Clay Products, but that such payment be made subject
first to the investigation as to whether the City was protected in the matter of the attach-
ment in suit of Fannie Ryan versus the Fuller Construction Company above mentioned.

Vote on said Resolution was as follows: Commissioners Mundy, German, Thomas and Hansell
and His Honor the Mayor E.W. Cragin voting aye.

The matter of the final payment due the Consulting Engineer, Webster L. Benham, on
contract as engineer of the sewer system and disposal plant just completed was next brought
before the Board for consideration.

On motion of Commissioner Thomas seconded by Commissioner Hansell it was moved that
the final payment to Webster L. Benham in the sum of $l2,45.75 be approved and the Clerk
directed to draw a warrant for the said amount.

Vote on said motion was as follows: Commissioners Mundy, German, Thomas and Hansell
and His Honor the Mayor E.W. Cragin voting Aye. Noes none.

Mr. Benham then presented to the Board a claim for $600.00 to pay for costs of
permanent records of the plans of the sewer mains just installed. After some discussion on the
matter on motion of Commissioner Hansell seconded by Commissioner Thomas it was moved that the
City pay Mr. Benham the sum of $600.00 for the permanent records for the City, and that Mr.
Benham agree in writing to furnish permanent records of the laterals under consideration if
same are constructed under his supervision, with out additional cost to the City.

Vote on said motion was as follows: Commissioners Thomas and Hansell and His Honor
the Mayor voting aye. Commissioners Mundy and German voting no.

The above mentioned permanent records being on file With the City Clerk at all times.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting recessed
until Thursday the 22nd day of September, 1932 at the hour of three o'clock P.M.

SEPTEMBER 22nd, 1932.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las
Vegas held on the 22nd day of September 1932 at the hour of three o'clock P.M.

Roll call showed the following present: Mayor Cragin, Commissioners Mundy and Thomas,
City Attorney and Clerk.

Absent Commissioners Hansell and German.

Harold Goumond appeared before the Board of Commissioners asking the Board for its per-
mission to erect a grandstand on the Court House Lawns.

On motion of Commissioner Thomas seconded by Commissioner Mundy it was moved that
the Board of Commissioners approve the erection of a band stand by the Las Vegas City Band on
the Court House Lawn subjest to the approval of the Board of County Commissioners. Site to
be selected by a member from each Board.

Vote on said motion was as follows: Commissioners Mundy and Thomas and His Honor the
Mayor voting aye. Noes none.

Mr. Goumond also appealed to the Board for financial aid for the Las Vegas City Bank,
to help cover costs of uniforms, music and material for band stand.

After some discussion on the matter on motion of Commissioner Mundy seconded by Com-
missioner Thomas it was moved that the City donate the sum of $50.00 from the Publicity Fund
toward the purchase of material for the band stand if the erection of a band stand in the
Court House yard meets with the approval of the Board of County Commissioners.

Vote on aid motion was as follows: Commissioners Thomas and Mundy and His Honor the
Mayor voting aye. Noes none.

At this time a number of restaurant owners in the City appeared before the Board
and ask that an ordinance governing sanitation in restaurants, cafes, lunch counter etc.
be read for a second time and passed. This ordinance having had a first reading some time
ago. After some discussion on the matter it was decided to wire the City of Reno and ask
for a copy of their ordinance covering sanitation in food emporiums.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting re-
cessed until the 26th day of September at the hour of three o'clock P.M.

The matter of the tax levy was brought before the Board of Commissioners for consideration,
and upon motion of Commissioner Thomas seconded by Commissioner Mundy the following Resolutions
were duly adopted and unanimously carried:

Resolved, that an ad valorem tax of $.171 on each one hundred dollars worth of taxable
property situate, lying and being within the City of Las Vegas, Nevada be levied, collected
and paid for the year 1932, including the net proceeds of the mines, except such property
as is exempt from taxation, said tax to be known as and used as the Salary Fund.

Resolved, that an ad valorem tax of $.216 on each one hundred dollars worth of taxable pro-
perty situate, lying and being within the City of Las Vegas, Nevada, be levied, collected, and
paid for the year 1932, including the net proceeds of the mines, except such property as is
exempt from taxation, said tax to known as and used as the General Fund.

Resolved, that an ad valorem tax of $.591 on each one hundred dollars worth of taxable
property situate, lying and being within the City of Las Vegas, Nevada, be levied, collected and
paid for the year 1932, including the net proceeds of the mines, except such property as is
exempt from taxation, said tax to be known as and used as the Street Fund.
Resolved, that an ad valorem tax of $.115 on each one hundred dollars worth of taxable
property situate, lying and being within the City of Las Vegas, Nevada, be levied, collected,
and paid for the year 1932, including the net proceeds from mines, except such property as
is	exempt from taxation,	said tax to	be	known as and	used	as The Water Sewer end Light	Fund.

Resolved, that an	ad valorem	tax	of $.021	on	each	one	hundred dollars worth	of	taxable

property situate, lying and being within the City of Las Vegas, Nevada, be levied, collected
and paid for the year 1932, including the net proceeds from mines, except such property as
is	exempt from taxation,	said tax to	be	known as	and	used	as	the Library Fund.

Resolved, that an	ad valorem	tax	of $.072	on	each	one	hundred dollars worth	of	taxable

property situate, lying and being within the City of Las Vegas, Nevada, be levied, col-
lected and paid for the year 1932, including net proceeds from mines, except such pro-
perty as is exempt from taxation, said tax to be known as and used as Bond Interest Fund.

Resolved, that an ad valorem tax of $.099 on each one hundred dollars worth of taxable
property situate, lying and being within the City of Las Vegas, Nevada, be levied, collected
and paid for the year 1932, including the net proceeds from mines, except such property as is
exempt from taxation, said tax to be know as and used as the Bond Redemption Fund,

Resolved, that an ad valorem tax of $.035 on each one hundred dollars worth of taxable
property situate, lying and being within the City of Las Vegas, Nevada, be levied collected
and paid for the year 1932, including the net proceeds from mines, except such property as is
exempt from taxation, said tax to be known as and used as the Publicity Fund.

Vote on the above Resolutions was as follows: Commissioners Mundy, German, Thomas and
Hansell and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes none.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting then adjourned.

City Commissioners.

Roll call at said special meeting showed the following present, Mayor Cragin, Com-
missioners German, Mundy and Thomas, City Attorney and Clerk.

Absent Commissioner Hansell.

It was called to the attention of the Board at this time that W.G. Morse, Municipal
Judge of the City of Las Vegas had passed away this morning, and on motion of Commissioner
German seconded by Commissioner Mundy the following Resolution was introduced and passed:

RESOLVED, Whereas, we, the Board of City Commissioners of the City of
Las Vegas, having received notice of the death this 7th day of October
1932 of W.G. Morse, for several years last past Municipal Judge of this
City, and for at least twenty years a valued and honored citizen of this
community, and

Whereas, his record as such Municipal Judge has been characterized by
wisdom, fair dealing and unquestionable honesty, and his judicial acts
tempered at all times with mercy, in such manner that the best interests
of the City and the ends of Justice have at all times been duly served
and the cause of the unfortunates with whom he had to deal, treated with
due and charitable consideration,

NOW THEREFORE, on behalf of the City of Las Vegas, its officials and
citizens we hereby express the great sorrow that is felt at the loss
of this valued officer and citizen, and also express heartfelt sympathy
towards his relatives and friends in their bereavement.

Let this Resolution be entered upon the minutes of this Board and the

records of the City, and copies thereof transmitted to his near relatives.

Vote on said Resolution was as follows: Commissioners Mundy, German, and
Thomas and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes none.

The Clerk was directed to order flowers sent in the name of the City of Las Vegas
to the funeral.

The matter of appointing a municipal judge for the City of Las Vegas was next brought
before the Board for consideration.

After due consideration on the matter Frank McNamee Jr. was upon mot ion
of Commissioner German seconded by Commissioner Mundy appointed Municipal Judge for the City
of Las Vegas, to hold office at the pleasure of the Board of Commissioners, and to qualify by
taking the official oath of office and filing a surety company bond in the sum of Two Thous-
and Dollars.

Vote on said motion was as follows: Commissioners Mundy, German, and Thomas and His
Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes none.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting then adjourned.

Mayor Pro Tem, City attorney and Clerk.

On motion of Commissioner Thomas seconded by Commissioner Mundy it was moved that all
slot machine application presented to the Board at this time be granted. Applications being in
proper form and money to cover same being on file with the clerk.

Vote on said motion was as follows: Commissioners Mundy end Thomas, and Mayor Pro tem
German voting aye. Noes none.

The Clerk was directed to write W.R. Bracken, of the Las Vegas Land and Water Company
and inform him that the City had placed a man at the site of the old dump ground for two weeks
directing people to the site of the new dump ground recently purchased by the City and the
State could prosecute any one found using the old dump ground since the new one has been pro-
vided. The Clerk was also directed to call Mr. Bracken's attention to the condition of the side-
walk at the north side of the Las Vegas Land & Water Co. Rooming house at Second & Lewis Sts.
The applications of E. Hicks and J.D. Smith for permission to tie into the sewer mains
in their respective alleys was presented to the Board at this time and laid over for further
consideration.

Mr. King, Supt. of Streets for the City of Las Vegas presented to the Board an estimate
of cost for repairing Fremont St. from Main to Third Street on both sides of the street. The
City to purchase the materials and the labor to be paid from the Reconstruction Finance Corp-
oration.

On motion of Commissioner Mundy seconded by Commissioner Thomas it was moved that Mr.
King be instructed to start the above mentioned work at an early date, and the labor to be
paid by the Reconstruction Finance Corporation.

Vote on said motion was as follows: Commissioners Mundy and Thomas, and Mayor Pro Tem
German voting aye. nones none.

On motion of Commissioner Mundy seconded by Commissioner Thomas it was moved to trans-
fer $500.00 from the Library saving account to the Library checking fund to cover purchases
made for new books.

Vote on the above motion was as follows: Commissioners Mundy and Thomas and Mayor Pro
Tem German voting aye. Noes none.

The matter of having the Clerk's office cleaned was next brought before the Board. Mr.
King reported that Dave Davidson would patch all plaster and fill all cracks and clean walls
for $14.00.	

On motion of Commissioner Mundy seconded by Commissioner Thomas it was moved and
carried that the City Clerk's office be cleaned by Dave Davidson at a cost of $14.00.

Vote was as follows: Commissioners Mundy and Thomas and Mayor Pro Tem German voting aye.
Noes none.

At this time a number of citizens protesting the erection of a slaughter house on the
Westside in the Industrial District appeared before the Board. Also The owners of the proposed
slaughter house and their Attorney Guy E. Baker. Dr. Mildren, City Health Officer attended this
meeting and he with the Board of Commissioners forms the Health Board. After some discussion on
the matter on both sides the Board of Commissioners with Dr. Mildren visited the site of the
proposed slaughter house and investigated the methods of operating the same. After their return
to the office it was upon motion of Commissioner Thomas seconded by Commissioner Mundy moved
that the Southern Nevada Marketing Association proceed with the construction of the building
being erected for a slaughter house and that permission was hereby granted for the operation
of the same when completed.

Vote on said motion was as follows: Commissioners Mundy and Thomas and Mayor Pro Tem
German voting aye. Noes none.

Attention was called at this time to the number of places of business in the City of
Las Vegas using radios and victrolas or other loud methods of advertising a place of bus-
iness.

The City Attorney was instructed to investigate the possibility of passing an ordin-
ance eliminating such means of advertising.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting recessed
until Wednesday the 19th day of October, 1932 at the hour of three o'clock P.M.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK, CITY OF LAS VEGAS,
October 19th, 1932.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK, CITY OF LAS VEGAS,
CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

OCTOBER 19th, 1932.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las
Vegas held on the 19th day of October 1932 at the hour of seven thirty o'clock P.M.

Roll call showed the following present, Mayor Cragin, Commissioners Mundy and German,
City Attorney and Clerk.

Absent Commissioners Thomas, and Hansell.

C.C. Underhill and A.L. Brackett appeared before the Board at this time protesting
the license fee on their respective businesses. They were informed that the licenses for the
fourth quarter would be as provided by Ordinance No. 184 of the City of Las Vegas, but that
the Board of Commissioners were contemplating a change in some fees to be in effect about the
first of the year.

Mr. Dinsmore appeared before the Board with Mr. Nash in regard to the passage of
a milk ordinance that had been considered some time before. No action was taken on the matter
at this time.

On motion of Commissioner German seconded by Commissioner Mundy it was moved that
the bond of O.C. Boggs, Chief of Police of the City of Las Vegas be accepted and approved
by the mayor. Said bond is from the Columbis Casuality Company.

Vote on said motion was as follows: Commissioners Mundy and German and His Honor
the Mayor voting aye. Noes none.

An ordinance entitled, "An Ordinance prohibiting soliciting for sexual intercourse,
occupying or renting rooms in any rooming house, hotel or other place in the City of Las
Vegas for the purpose of sexual intercourse with a person to whom he or she is not married,
and to require all keepers of hotels or lodging houses to keep a register of all persons
occupying rooms in such hotel or lodging house, was read for a first time and laid over
for a second reading.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting recessed
until Wednesday the 26th day of October 1932, at the hour of three o'clock P.M.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK, CITY OF LAS VEGAS,

OCTOBER 26th, 1932.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of
Las Vegas held on the 26th day of October 1932 at the hour of three o'clock P.M.

The following answered roll call, Mayor Cragin, Commissioners Mundy, Hansell and
German, City Attorney and Clerk.

Absent Commissioner Thomas.

The Board at this time entered into a discussion in regard to the using of the
sewer mains as laterials where same might be used for laterals. No action was taken on the
natter at this time but the City Attorney was directed to draw up the necessary papers and ordinances
.

The next business brought before the Board for consideration was the construction
of a drainage system west of the Union Pacific R.R. tracks.

On motion of Commissioner German seconded by Commissioner Mundy it was moved that
A.R. Thompson, Engineer for the City be directed to investigate the cost of same and make borings
as to the depths of the water and report back to the Board in the near future.

On motion of Commissioner Mundy seconded by Commissioner German it was moved that
all slot machine applications presented to the Board at this time be granted. Applications being
in proper form and money to cover same being on file with the Clerk.

Vote was as follows: Commissioners Mundy and German and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye, Noes none.

An ordinance entitled, "An Ordinance prohibiting the use or occupation of the
public streets or places in the City of Las Vegas for advertising purposes, " was read for a
first time and laid over for a second reading.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting then recessed
until Monday the 31st day of October, 1932 at the hour of three o'clock P.M.
OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK, CITY OF LAS VEGAS,
CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

OCTOBER 31st, 1932.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las
Vegas held on the 31st day of October 1932 at the hour of three o'clock P.M.

Roll call showed the following present, Mayor Cragin, Commissioners Mundy, Thomas and
Hansell and City Attorney and Clerk.

Absent Commissioner German.

At this time the Board again considered the granting of permission to property owners
to tie into the sewer mains and use same as laterals. After some discussion on the matter
an ordinance entitled, "An Ordinance establishing regulations for connection with sewer mains
in Sanitary Lateral Sewer District No. 1 in the City of Las Vegas, establishing a sinking fund
and providing for the disposal of such fund, providing a penalty for the violation of this
Ordinance, and repealing pro tanto all ordinances and parts of ordinances in conflict therewith;

was read for a first time and laid over for a second reading.

On motion of Commissioner Hansell seconded by Commissioner Thomas it was moved that
the bid of the Fuller Construction Company in the sum of $77,257,27 of June loth, 1932 be
rejected and that the local representative be notified to that effect. Said bid of the Fuller
Construction Company being one of several received on the above mentioned date, and all bids
being rejected on that date except the bid of the Fuller Construction Co. The reason for the
rejection of the said bid of the Fuller Construction Co. being that the City of Las Vegas is
unable at this time to sell the special assessment bonds necessary for the payment of the
said improvement, owing to the very low condition of the bond market at the present time.

The Clerk be directed to also notify the Union Indemnity Company that it is released from
further surety on the bid bond of the Fuller Construction Company executed on the 29th day of
July, 1932 in the sum of $6,000.00.

Vote on said motion was as follows: Commissioners Mundy, Thomas and Hansell and His
Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes none.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting then ad-
journed.

Roll called showed the following present, Mayor Cragin, Commissioners Mundy, Thomas and Ger-
man, City Attorney and Clerk/

Absent Commissioner Hansell.

At this time L.H. Reece appeared before the Board of Commissioners in regard to the revocation
of a permit granted the Southern Nevada Market Association for the operation of a slaughter
to be operated on the Ullom property on the Westside of the City of Las Vegas and ask that the
permit be granted to operate the same on a site on the Russell property.

On motion of Commissioner German, seconded by Commissioner Mundy it was moved that the
Board revoke the permit granted to the Southern Nevada Market Association for the operation of
a slaughter house on the Ullom property on the Westside of the City of Las Vegas and that permit
be granted the Southern Nevada Market Association to operate a slaughter house on the following
described property situate on what is known as the Russell Ranch.:

Commencing at a point on the north boundary of the S.E. ¼ of Section 29, T.P. 20 S. Rg.61
E: M.D.M. forom which the ¼ Sec. Cor. between Sections 28 and 29 T. 20 S.R. 61 E. Bears
S.88 27' E. 57' Ft. Dist; running Thence parallel to the East Boundary of said Section,

29, S. 0 25' E. 1320.	7 Ft. to a point on the North Boundary of the right of way of

Clark Avenue, prolonged; thence along the North Boundary of Clark Ave. right of way N.88
44' W. 330 ft.: Thence parallel to the east boundary of said Sec. 29 N. 0 25' W. 1342.3 ft.
to a point on the North boundary of the S.E. ¼ of the said Sec. 29 thence along the North
boundary of the S.E. ¼ of said Sec. 29, S. 88 27' E. 33 ft. to the place of the beginning.
Vote on said motion being as follows: Commissioners Mundy German and Thomas and His Honor
the Mayor voting Aye. Noes none.

Dr. Mildren, City Health was in attendance at the meeting and sanctioned the action of the
Board of Commissioners in the granting of the above permit.

	

A letter from the Clark County Archaeological Society was read to the Board at this time asking
for some financial support from the City of Las Vegas in the furthering of the work of that
Society,

On motion of Commissioner Mundy, seconded by Commissioner Thomas it was moved that the
City give the sum of One Hundred Dollars from the Publicity Fund to the Clark County Archaeologi-
cal Society for the carring on of the work of that society.

Vote on said motion was as follows: Commissioners Mundy, German, and Thomas and His Honor
the Mayor voting aye. Noes none.

that the City of Las Vegas pay the balance due the Von Tobel Lumber Company on materials used in

Electric Company the amount due them for materials amounting to $28.98 used for wiring the same.

Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes none.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK, CITY OF LAS VEGAS,

Clark County, Nevada.

December 22nd, 1932.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las
Vegas held on the 22nd day of December 1932 at the hour of three o'clock P.M.

Roll call showed the following present, Mayor Cragin, Commissioners Mundy, Thomas
add Hansell, City Clerk and acting City Attorney.

Absent Commissioner German.

Mr. C.D.Baker appeared before the Board at this time and ask if the City would	give

some	aid in the providing of fuel for	the needy	at this time.

After some discussion on the matter on	motion of Commissioner Hansell seconded by

Commissioner Thomas it was moved that J.P. King	Supt. of Streets	direct the cutting and

hailing of wood to the City Stockade where the City saw would be used in the cutting of the
wood into stove lengths to be turned over to the Red Cross as a clearing house.

Vote on said motion was as follows: Commissioners Thomas and Hansell and His Honor
the Mayor voting aye. Noes none.

On motion of Commissioner Hansell seconded by Commissioner Thomas it was moved that
ten slot machine licenses be granted to J.T.Watters for the fourth quarter, 1932. Applications
being in proper form and money to cover same being on file with the Clerk.

Vote on said motion was as follows; Commissioners Thomas, Hansell and His Honor the
Mayor voting aye. Noes none.

At this time the passage of a suitable Resolution on the demise of City attorney
F. A. Stevens was brought before the Board and the following was enacted, on motion of 
Commissioner Hansell seconded by Commissioner Thomas,

WHEREAS, on the 6th day of December, 1932, City Attorney F.A. Stevens departed
this life, and

Whereas, the said F.A. Stevens, as City Attorney of the City of Las Vegas, was and has
been a loyal, faithful, conscientious and learned advisor of the City for a period of over
twenty years, and

Whereas, in the death of F.A. Stevens, the City of Las Vegas has suffered a great
loss, and the County of Clark and the State of Nevada, a worthy and valuable citizen,

NOW THEREFORE

On motion duly made, seconded and unanimously carried, the following Resolution was
duly adopted:

Resolved, that the City of Las Vegas, by and throught its Mayor and Board
of City Commissioners, deeply feels the loss sustained, and extends to the
widow and daughter of F.A. Stevens its deepest expression of condolence and
sympathy in their bereavement, and bespeaks the individual sorrow of the
Mayor and each member of the Board of City Commissioners and the officers of
said City with whom the said F.A. Stevens labored.

BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED that a copy of this Resolution be spread upon the
minutes of the Board of City Commissioners, and a copy be forwarded to the
widow and daughter of the deceased.

Vote oh the above Resolution was as follows: Commissioners Mundy, German, Thomas
and Hansell and His Honor the Mayor E.W. Cragin voting aye. noes none.

At this time the appointing of a City attorney was considered by the Board of
City Commissioners, and the name of A.S. Henderson was placed before the Board for consider-
ation by Commissioner Thomas. Mr. Henderson having been acting City Attorney for the City of
Las Vegas since December 8th, 1932 on appointment made by the Mayor, E.W. Cragin.

On motion of Commissioner Thomas Seconded by Commissioner Mundy A.S. Henderson was
appointed City Attorney for the City of Las Vegas, same to be effective as of Jan. 1st, 1933,
to hold office at the pleasure of the Board of Commissioners and to qualify by taking the
official oath of office and filing a bond in the sum of One Thousand Dollars with the City.

Vote on said motion was as follows: Commissioners Mundy, German, Thomas and Hansell
and His Honor the Mayor E.W. Cragin voting aye. Noes none.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting adjourned.
OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK, CITY OF LAS VEGAS,
CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

JANUARY 4th, 1933.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of
Las Vegas held on the 4th day of January 1933 at the hour of seven thirty o'clock P.M.

Roll call showed the following present, Mayor Cragin, Commissioners Mundy, German, and
Thomas, City Attorney and Clerk, also Alfred Blackman, Auditor.

At this time the Board entered	into	a	discussion	of	ways	and	means	to	finance	the City

of Las Vegas for the present year. After	some	discussion	on	the	matter	it	was	decided	by	the

members of the Board present to reduce expenses in all departments to the lowest possible figure.

On motion of Commissioner Mundy, seconded by Commissioner Thomas the following Resolu-
tion was introduced a d passed:

Resolved, that the following schedule for salaries for the following officers be in
effect from and after Jan. 1st, 1933 until the further order of the Board of Commissioners:

J.M. Ullom, City Treasurer	$50.00 Per month

F.C. DeVinney City Assessor	$50.00	"	"

A.S. Henderson City Attorney	$200.00	"	"

and the salary of Viola Burns, City Clerk be reduced 10% per month placing said salary at $180.00
per month upon said City Clerk, volunteering and offering to take such reduction in salary, same
to be in effect until the City is financially able to warrant the salary being returned to $200.00
per month.

Vote on the Resolution was as follows: Commissioners Mundy, German, Thomas and His
Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes none.

The Clerk was directed to notify the above officers in writing of the changes in effect.

0 motion of Commissioner Thomas, seconded by Mayor Cragin the following R solution
was introduced and passed:

Resolved, that commencing with the 1st day of January, 1933 that the salary payroll
of the Police and Street Departments be reduced 10% or more. This reduction to be made on the
pay roll in its entirety.

Vote on the Resolution was as follows: Commissioners Mundy, German and Thomas and His
Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes none.

Mr. C.C. Boyer, Division Supt. of Highways, State of Nevada appeared before the Board
at this time in regard to the encroachments on the Highways in the City of Las Vegas. After
some discussion on the matter the following Resolutions were introduced and passed.

On motion of Commissioner Thomas, seconded by Commissioner Mundy the following Preambles
and Resolution were duly adopted:

WHEREAS, The Department of Highways, State of Nevada, is desirous of constructing a
portion of State Highway Route No. 101A within the City of Las Vegas from the south line of Fremont
Street extending along Fifth Street to the South Line of Garces Street, and

WHEREAS, The Department of Highways, State of Nevada, is desirous of receiving Federal
Aid for the improvement of said highway, and

WHEREAS, the Bureau of Public Roads of the Department of Agriculture of the United
States of America will not participate in the construction of said highway until and unless the
City of Las Vegas will agree to refrain from permitting encroachments upon the right of way of said
above mentioned street,

THEREFORE, BE IT RESOLVED, By the City Council of the City of Las Vegas that for and in-
consideration of the Department of Highways, State of Nevada, the Bureau of Public Roads, Depart-
ment of Agriculture, constructing said highway, it hereby agrees with the said Department of
Highways, State of Nevada, and the Bureau of Public Roads, Department of Agriculture, that it
will not, in the future, permit encroachments on the right of way of said above mentioned street.

Vote on said Resolution was as follows: Commissioners Mundy, German, and Thomas and His
Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes none.

On motion of Commissioner Thomas Seconded by Commissioner Mundy the following Preambles
and Resolution were duly adopted:

WHEREAS, The Department of Highways, State of Nevada, is desirous of constructing a
portion of State Highway Route No. 87A within the City of Las Vegas, from the north line of
Fremont Street extending along Main Street to the North line of Main Street, and Stewart Street, and
WHEREAS, the Department of Highways, State of Nevada, is desirous of receiving Federal
Aid for the improvement of said highway, and

WHEREAS, the Bureau of Public Roads, of the Department of Agriculture of the United
State of America will not participate in the construction of said Highway until and unless the
City of Las Vegas will agree to refrain from permitting encroachments upon right of way of said
above mentioned street,

THEREFORE, BE IT RESOLVED, By the City Council of the City of Las Vegas that for and
in consideration of the Department of Highways, State of Nevada, and the Bureau of Public Roads,
Department of Agriculture, constructing said highway, it hereby agrees with the said Department of
Highways, State of Nevada, and the Bureau of Public Roads, Department of Agriculture, that it
will not, in the future, permit encroachments on the right of way of way of said above mentioned
street.

Vote on said Resolution was as follows: Commissioners Mundy, German, and Thomas,
and His Honor the Mayor E.W. Cragin voting aye. Noes none.

On motion of Commissioner Thomas, seconded by Commissioner German, it was moved and
carried that the Department of Highways, State of Nevada, be given permission to use the sewer
main at Fifth and Bonneville Sts. as a drain until such time as the City finds that there is an
excessive amount of water being drained into said sewer main. All joints of said drain draining
into said manhole on Bonneville Street just of Fifth Street must be tight.

Vote on said motion was as follows: Commissioners Mundy, German, and Thomas and His
Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes none.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City
of Las Vegas, Nevada.

Roll call showed the following present Mayor Cragin, Commissioners Mundy, German,
and Thomas, City Clerk, and Acting City Attorney Marshall.

Absent Commissioner Hansell and City Attorney Handerson.

Mr. O. Piffer, and Dr. W.S. Park as a Committee of Public Morals from the Grand
Jury, and A.C.Grant President of the C. of C. and A.H. Harrington appeared before this time
and ask that the Board of Commissioners investigate into the operation of Keno parlors in
the City of Las Vegas as the same had been reported to be of a demoralizing character to
the City of Las Vegas, and that the same had been termed a lottery.

Acting City Attorney Marshall was ask to present to the Board at an early date
a written decision as to the character of Keno and lottery. Dr. Park, was also ask to pre-
sent a written decision from the District Attorney of Clark County, and the Attorney General
of the State of Nevada.

No other action was taken on the matter at this time.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK, CITY OF
LAS VEGAS, CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

MARCH 1st, 1933.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of
Las Vegas held on the 1st day of March 1933 at the hour of seven thirty o'clock P.M.

Roll call showed the following present, Mayor Cragin, Commissioners Mundy, German,
and Thomas, Acting City Attorney Marshall and City Clerk.

Absent Commissioner Hansell and City Attorney Henderson.

At this time Dr. W.S. Park of the Public Morals Committee of the Grand Jury
appeared before the Board in regards to the operation of Keno palors in the City of Las
Vegas. He reported to the Board that the had been unable to receive either a written
decision from the Attorney General or Senator Henderson or the District Attorney. Acting
City Attorney Marshall presented to the Board a written decision of the game Keno, and
quoted various decisions that had been decided in several courts.

That it has been called to the attention of this Board, by a committee of the
Grand Jury, that the playing of Keno as a licensed game it the City of Las Vegas has a
demoralizing effect upon the good morals of the City of Las Vegas, and further that the
game constitutes a lottery, and is an unlawful game; that pursuant to said written notice
a written opinion from the City Attorney of this City holding Keno to be a lotter, and an
unlawful game, has been delivered to this Board, and after due discussion and consideration
thereon, it was moved by Commissioner German, and seconded by Commissioner Mundy, that the
application for a Keno license from the Boulder Club Inc; be denied, and that any and all
Keno licenses now issued be and the same are hereby revoked, cancelled, and held not
effective March 2nd, 1933 at the hour of 12 o'clock noon, for the reason that the same con-
stitutes a lottery and are prohibited by the Constitution of the State of Nevada, Article
IV, Section 24.

Be It Further Resolved, that any and all persons holding licenses and any
and all persons having before this Board of City Commissioners applications for licenses for
Keno be notified in writing of this action, by serving upon all of such persons a copy
hereof.

Vote on said Resolution was as Follows: Commissioners Mundy, German, and Thomas and
His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes none.

At this time the Board discussed the Bill No. 77, introduced by Senator Henderson of
Clark County, in the Senate of the State Legislature now in session in Carson City. Said
Bill No. 77, if passed would prohibit the use of script in the state of Nevada.

On motion of Commissioner Mundy seconded by Commissioner German it was moved that
the Delegations both in the House and the Senate from Clark County press the immediate
passage of such bill, and that the Clerk notify the said Delegations by Western Union,
Telegram.

Vote on said motion was as follows: Commissioners Mundy, German and Thomas
and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes none.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting then

adjourned.

The vote on the adoption of the Budget was as follows: Commissioners Mundy and German

The tax levy was next brought before the Board for consideration add on motion of
Commissioner German, seconded by Commissioner Mundy the following Resolutions were introduced
and passed:

Resolved, that an ad valorem tax of $.16 on each one hundred dollars worth of taxable
property situate, lying and being within the City of Las Vegas, Nevada, be levied, collect and
paid for the year 1933, including the net proceeds of the mines, except such property as is
exempt from taxation, said tax to be known as and used as the Salary Fund.

Resolved, that an ad valorem tax of $.270 on each one hundred dollars worth of tax-
able property situate, lying and being within the City of Las Vegas, Nevada, be levied,
collected and paid for the year 1933, including the net proceeds of the mines, except such
property as is exempt from taxation, said tax to be known as and used as General Fund.

Resolved, that an ad valorem tax of $.301 on each one hundred dollars worth of
taxable property situate, lying and being within the City of Las Vegas, Nevada, be levied,
collected and paid for the year 1933, including the net proceeds of the mines, except such
property as is exempt by law, said tax to be known as and used as the Street Fund.

Resolved, that an ad valorem tax of $.198 on each one hundred dollars worth of
taxable property situate, lying and being within the City of Las Vegas, Nevada, be levied,
collected and paid for the year 1933, including the net proceed of the mines, except such
property as is exempt by law, said tax to be known as and used as the Water Sewer Light Fund.

Resolved, that an ad valorem tax of $.026 on each one hundred dollars worth of
taxable property situate, lying and being within the City of Las Vegas, Nevada, be levied,
collected and paid for the year 1933, including the net proceeds of the mines, except such
property as is exempt by law, said tax to be known as and used as the Library Fund.
Resolved, that an ad valorem tax of $.240 on each one hundred dollars worth of tax-
able property situate, lying and being within the City of Las Vegas, Nevada, be levied,
collected and paid for the year, 1933, including the net proceeds of the mines, except such
property as is exempt by law, said tax to be known as and used as the Bond Interest Fund.

Resolved; THAT AN AD VALOREM TAX OF $.295 on each one hundred dollars worth of tax-
able property situate, lying and being within the City of Las Vegas, Nevada, be levied,
collected and paid for the the year, 1933, including the net proceeds of the mines, except
such property as is exempt by law, said tax to be known as and used as the Bond Redemption Fund.

Resolved, that an ad valorem tax of $010 on each one hundred dollars worth of taxable
property situate lying and being within the City of Las Vegas, Nevada, be levied, collected,
and paid for the year, 1933, including the net proceeds of the mines, except such property as
is exempt by law, said tax to be known as and used as the Publicity Fund.

Vote on the above Resolutions was as follows: Commissioners Mundy, and German, and
His Honor the Mayor, E.W. Cragin voting aye. Nones none.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK, CITY OF LAS VEGAS,
CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

MARCH 10th, 1933.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of
Las Vegas, held on the 10th day of March, 1933 at the hour of three o'clock P.M.

Roll call showed the following present, Mayor Cragin, Commissioners Mundy, German,
Thomas and Hansell, City Clerk and acting City Attorney Marshall.

Absent City Attorney Henderson.

At this time the Board took up the matter of providing for the General City Elect-
ion to be held on the 2nd day of May, 1933, for the purpose of electing two City Commissioners
and a City Clerk for the City of Las Vegas. Thereupon motion of Commissioner German, seconded
By Commissioner Thomas the following Preamble and Resolution was duly adopted:

Whereas, under the provisions of Section 3 Chapter 11 of the Charter of the City
of Las Vegas, Nevada, as amended by the Legislature of the State of Nevada, in the year 1929,
a General City Election must be held on the first Tuesday after the first Monday in May, 1933,
and it appearing therefrom that such election should be called and prepared for, Now Therefore

BE IT RESOLVED, that a General City Election be and the same is hereby ordered to
be held in said City of Las Vegas, on the 2nd day of May, 1933, for the purpose of electing
two Commissioners, namely: a Commissioner of Class 2, and a Commissioner of Class 4, and a
City Clerk, at the places hereinafter set forth.

BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED, that for the purpose of complying with the provisions of
said section 3, Chapter 11 of said Charter of said City of Las Vegas, as amended in 1923, said
City of Las Vegas be and it is hereby divided into ten election precincts, as follows:

PRECINCT No. 1, which is bounded on the north by the northern limit of the City
of Las Vegas; on the east by the center line of Fifth Street from the said northern limit of
said city, south to the center line of Stewart Street, thence west along the center line of
Stewat Street to the Center line of Third Street, thence south along the center line of Third
Street to the Center lien of Fremont Street, and on the south by the center line of Third
Street to the right-of-way of the Union Pacific Railroad from the center of Fremont Street
to the northern city limit.

PRECINCT NO. 2, which is bounded as follows: Beginning at the point where Clark
Avenue in the Original Townsite of Las Vegas intersects the eastern line of the Union Pacific
right-of-way to a continuation of the center line of Fremont Street ; thence east along the
center line of Fremont Street to the center lien of Third Street; thence south along the center
line of Third Street to the center line of Bridger Street; thence west along the center line
of Bridger Street to the eastern boundary of the Union Pacific right-of-way; thence south along

BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED, that no candidate for office at such election shall be en-
titled to have his name placed upon the official ballot unless such candidate shall, not more than
fifty days nor less than thirty days before the date of election, file in the office of the
City Clerk of said City of Las Vegas, Nevada, a petition of nomination, in writing contain-
ing name of the person nominated, the office for which he is nominated, and setting forth
his qualifications as required by Section 6, of chapter 11 of the City Charter of said City
of Las Vegas. Such petition shall be subscribed and sworn to by the candidate nominated ; and
there shall be charged each candidate, for filing such petition of nomination, a fee of $5.00,
which shall be paid to the City Clerk at the time of filing and for the General Fund of said
City.

BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED that the City Clerk of said City be, and she is hereby
authorized and directed to notify the County Clerk of Clark County, Nevada, to open registra-
tion for the registration of voters of said City of Las Vegas for said General City Election
at the time and in the manner provided by the laws of the State of Nevada, governing the re-
gistration of voters, such registration to open on the 10th day of March, 1933 and close on
the 12th day of Paril, 1933.
BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED that the City Clerk of said City of Las Vegas be, and she is
hereby authorized and directed to have official prepared and to do and perform all such
other or further acts, and give such notices as me be necessary or required by the Charter
of said city or by the general election laws of the State of Nevada, in order that said
election may be called and held, and that the qualified voters of said city may have due
notice thereof.

BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED, that all provisions of the general election laws of the State
of Nevada, so far as the same may be applicable and not inconsistent with the said City
Charter of the said City of Las Vegas, shall be observed in conducting said election.

BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED, that the Mayor or Mayor Pro. Tem. of said City of Las Vegas be
and he is hereby authorized and directed to issue a proclamation giving notice of the holding
of said election, and that such proclamation contain the information necessary to fairly
apprize the qualified voters of said City of Las Vegas of the date, time, and place of hold-
ing and purposes of said election.

BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED, that such election proclamation be published in the Las Vegas
Review-Journal, a daily newspaper printed and published in the City of Las Vegas, County of
Clark, State of Nevada, for one issue not less than six weeks prior to the date of such
election, and that printed copies of such proclamation be posted forthwith by the City Clerk
of said City in not less than three conspicuous places in each election precinct.

The ballot at such election shall contain such further questions as may properly
be submitted to the vote of the qualified electors of said City.

The vote on said Resolution was as follows: Commissioners Mundy and German, Thomas and
Hansell and His Honor the Mayor E.W. Cragin voting aye. Noes none.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting recessed
until Friday the 31st day of March, 1933 at the hour of three o'clock P.M.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK, CLARK COUNTY.

LAS VEGAS, NEVADA.

MARCH 31st, 1933 

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the
City of Las Vegas, held on the 31st day of March 31st, 1933 at the hour of three o'clock P.M.

Roll call showed the following answered roll call, May Cragin, Commissioners
Mundy, German, Thomas, City Attorney and City Clerk

Commissioner Hansell absent.

A Petition from Cora J. Noblitt petitioning the Board of Commissioners to
approve the proposed amended plat of of the Noblitt Addition to the City of Las Vegas in
the form presented to the Board of Commissioners at this time.

On motion of Commissioner Mundy Seconded by Commissioner Thomas it was
moved and carried that the plat, amended, as presented to the Board of Commissioners be
approved, and same be signed by the Mayor and Attest by the City Clerk. Proof being also
presented to the Board at this time of the same bearing a clear title in the name of said
Cora J. Noblitt.

Vote on said motion was as follows: Commissioners Mundy, German, and Thomas
and His Honor the Mayor voting Aye. Noes none.

At this time a petition was also presented to the Board for its consideration
to allow angle parking on Fremont Street from Main to Third Streets, said petition being
signed by a number of property owners, and proprietors of business in said mentioned blocks,

On motion of Commissioner German, seconded by Commissioner Mundy it was moved
and carried that said petition for angle parking on Fremont Street from Main to Third Street
be denied, and that the Clerk be directed to write M.E. Ward, circulator of said petition to
that effect.

Vote on said petition being as follows: Commissioners Mundy, German, Thomas
and His Honor the Mayor voting Aye. Noes none.

On motion of Commissioner Thomas, seconded by Commissioner Mundy it was
moved and carried that the Publicity Fund pay to the following upon demand:

Chamber of Commerce	$300.00

Veterans of Foreign Wars	500.00

Street Fund (for cement)	200.00

Said amounts to be paid upon demand only.

Vote on said motion was as follows: Commissioners Mundy, German, Thomas
and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes none.
"An Ordinance to Regulate and control the use of Streets, Alleys, Avenues, and Side-
walks, Providing a penalty for the Violation of this Ordinance, and Repealing all Ordinances
or parts of Ordinance in Conflict Therewith," was passed upon the following vote: Com-
missioners Mundy, German, and Thomas and His Honor the Mayor voting Aye. Noes none.

Above Ordinance to be know as Ordinance No. 197 of the City of Las Vegas, and to be
in full force and effect from and afters its final publication in the Las Vegas Age, as is
required by law, and said Ordinance No. 197 is passed as an emergency Ordinance.

"An Ordinance Regulating The Distribution Of Beer, Wine, Or Other Beverages Which
are Now Or May Hereafter Be Authorized By The Laws Of teh United States To Be Sold Or 
Distributed; Regulating Places Where And Conditions Under Which Such Liquors Or Beverages May
Be Sold Or Otherwise Distributed; Providing For the Issuance Of Permits and Licenses And
The Imposing of Taxes; And Repealing All Ordinances Or Parts Of Ordinances In Conflict
Therewith," was read and passed as and emergency Ordinance upon the following vote: Com-
missioners Mundy, German, Thomas and His Honor the Mayor voting Aye. Noes none.

Said Ordinance to be knows as Ordinance No. 198 of the City of Las Vegas, and to
be in full force and effect from and after its final publication was provided by law. Said
Ordinance to be published in Las Vegas Age.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting
then adjourned.

and wholesale liquor licenses.

and that the Clerk order for immediate delivery five hundred such application.

Pro Tem German voting aye. Noes none.

all gaming licenses presented to the Board at this time be approved. Applications for licenses
being in proper form and money to cover same being on file with the City Clerk.

Vote on said motion was as follows: Commissioner Mundy, Thomas and Hansell and Mayor
Pro Tem German voting aye. Noes none.

On motion of Commissioner Hansell seconded by Commissioner Mundy it was moved that all
slot machine application presented to the Board at this time be granted. Applications being
in proper form and money to cover same being on file with the Clerk.

Vote on said motion was as follows: Commissioner Mundy, Thomas and Hansell and Mayor
Pro Tem German voting aye. Noes none.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK, CITY OF LAS VEGAS,

CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

APRIL SETH, 1933.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las
Vegas held on the 7th day of April 1933.

Roll call showed the following present, Mayor Cragin, Commissioners Mundy, German, and
Thomas, City Attorney and Clerk.

Absent Commissioner Hansell.

At this time the Board took up the matter of zoining the City of Las Vegas in regard
to the issuance of beer licenses for draught beer.

 On motion of Commissioner Mundy Seconded by Commissioner German the following Preambles 

and Resolution was duly adopted;

Whereas, it appearing to the Board of City Commissioners that the sale, distribution
and giving away of draught beer should be confined to certain portions of the City,

Now therefor, on motion duly made, seconded and unanimously carried, it is
Resolved, that draft beer should only be sold, distributed or given away in said
city within the following limits: From the north side of Carson Street north to
Stewart Street, including all buildings on Stewart Street facing and abutting on
Stewart Street between Main and Second Street, and from the east side of Main
Street east to the west side of Second Street:

BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED, that it shall be unlawful for any person, firm corporation
co-partnership, Association social club, or association of persons of any kind what-
soever, to sell, distribute, or offer to sell any draught beer outside of said limits;

BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED, that a violation of this Resolution shall be sufficient cause
for the Board of City Commissioner to revoke, cancel and declare forfeit any license
hereto fore granted or hereafter granted for the sale, distribution or giving away
of beer, wine, or other beverages which are now or may hereafter be authorized by the
Laws of the United States, as authorized by Ordinance No. 198 of the City of Las
Vegas.

Vote on said Resolution was as follows: Commissioners Mundy and German and His Honor
the Mayor voting aye. Noes none. Commissioner Thomas being excused before the vote was called.

At This time the Board entered into a discussion of granting a number of liquor
permits that was applied for by a number of business houses. After due consideration and
discussion a number of licenses were granted. Same being approved by the Mayor.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting recessed
until Friday the 14th day of April at the hour of three o'clock P.M.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK, CITY OF LAS VEGAS.
CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

APRIL 14th, 1933.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of
Las Vegas, held on the 14th day of April, 1933 at the hour of three o'clock P.M.

Roll call showed the following present, Mayor Cragin, Commissioners Mundy and German,
City Attorney and Clerk.

Absent Commissioner Thomas and Hansell.

A Number of liquor applications were presented to the Board at this time and after due
consideration on the matter it was on motion of Commissioner Mundy Seconded by Commissioner
German, that the Resolution passed on April 7th, 1933 in regard to a zone in the City of Las
Vegas where draught beer might be sold, be rescinded at this time and that each application
would be considered as same was presented to the Board, and that the Board grant licenses
for draught beer where in their judgement a draught beer license appeared phasable.

Vote on said motion was as follows: Commissioners Mundy, German and His Honor the Mayor
voting aye. Noes none.

The awarding of the gasoline contract for the year was next brought before the Board,
and it appearing to the Board of Commissioners that the bid of the Texas Company being the
best bid for the City of Las Vegas to accept, it was on motion of Commissioner Mundy, second-
ed and carried that the City of Las Vegas enter into a contract with the Texas company. Said
contract to be in force ninety days from day of acceptance of bid, in accordance with the
contract had with the Shell Oil Company, setting for a ninety day notice of the cancelization
of said contract. Clerk to notify Shell Oil Company of the cancelization of said contract,
and to inform the Texas Company of the acceptance of its bid and ask that a form of con-
tract from the Texas Company be presented to the Board for its approval.

Vote on said Motion was as follows: Commissioners Mundy and German, and His Honor the
Mayor voting aye. Noes none.

The awarding of the water rights from the City well for the year March 23, 1933 to
March 23, 1934 was next brought before the Board.

On motion of Commissioner Mundy seconded by Commissioner German it was moved and
carried that the Agreement entered into with one J.W. Williams and the City of Las Vegas,
on March 23, 1932 to March 23, 1933 be extended to March 23, 1934, has said J.W. Williams
had fulfilled all the terms of the said agreement and was anxious to receive and extension
on said agreement.

Vote on said motion was as follows: Commissioners Mundy and German and His Honor the
Mayor voting aye. Noes none.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting then recessed
until Friday the 21st day of April at the hour of three o'clock P.M.
On motion of Commissioner German, seconded by Commissioner
Mundy the following Preambles and Resolution were duly adopted:

WHEREAS, Clark Street Between Sixth and Seventh Streets, in
Wardie Addition to the City of Las Vegas, and the alley between
Sixth and Seventh Streets from Clark Street to Bonneville Street
in said Wardie Addition, have been and are becoming in an impass-
ible condition by reason of being flooded with water leaking from
the water main supplying water to said section, and

WHEREAS the Water main supplying said Wardie Addition to the
City of Las Vegas in the alley above mentioned is in such a con-
dition that a continuation of the present condition constitutes
and is now a nuisance and a menace to the residents of said section
of said City of Las Vegas, and

WHEREAS, said leaking water main has now caused considerable
damage to the said street and alley and if said condition is allowed
to continue will cause further damage to said street and alley, and
may cause damage to the property bordering oh same, and

WHEREAS demands have been made upon the has Vegas Land & Water
Company, the South Nevada Land & Development Company, and the
Miller-Buzick Corporation, each of which are corporations doing busi-
ness in the City of Las Vegas, State of Nevada, to repair the same,
and

WHEREAS, no consideration has been given by any of the above
corporations to the demands made by the City, NOW THEREFORE,

BE IT RESOLVED, that the City of Las Vegas, by and
through its proper department, repair or cause to
be repaired the said pipe line so that said condition
will be remedied, and for that purpose the said de-
partment is hereby authorized and directed to repair
the same;

BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED that as soon as said repairs
are made, the said department making said repair
or repairs render a statement to the Board of Comm-
issioners showing the actual necessary cost thereof,
and that immediately thereafter the City Attorney
bring suit against any and all parties interested
or who may be interested in the supplying of said
water and the maintenance of said water distributing
system, for the amount expended by the City;

BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED, that the City Attorney shall
also bring such proceedings as he may determine pro-
per to compel the parties owning or to own or having
charge of the water distributing system for Wardie
Addition to the City of Las Vegas, Nevada, to maintain
the same in such manner as will adequately serve the
people of said Addition with water and not suffer any
damage to be done to the streets and alleys of said
City.

Vote on said Resolution was as follows: Commissioners
Mundy, German and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.

Noes none.
OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK, CITY OF LAS VEGAS.

CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

APRIL 21st, 1933.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las
Vegas, held on the 21st day of April at the hour of three o'clock P.M.

Roll call showed the following present, Mayor Cragin, Commissioners Mundy and German,
City Attorney and Clerk.

Absent Commissioners Thomas and Hansell.

On motion of Commissioner German, seconded by Commissioner Mundy it was moved and
carried that all slot machine applications on file with the City Clerk be granted.

Vote on the motion was as follows: Commissioners Mundy and German, and His Honor the
Mayor voting aye. Noes none.

On motion of Commissioner Mundy seconded by Commissioner German it was moved and
carried that J.F. Hesse be granted a wholesale liquor license. License fee $50.00.

Vote on said motion was as follows: Commissioners Mundy and German and His Honor
the Mayor voting Aye. Noes none.

At this time the Board of Commissioners entered into a discussion as to the combin-
ing of the City and County Health doctors. No action was taken on the matter.

On motion of Commissioner German seconded by Commissioner Mundy it was moved and
carried that the Las Vegas Taxi and the Boulder Taxi be given 20ft space to be used as
a taxi stand. Permission of the owners of the Boulder Club 118 Fremont St. stand of the
Boulder Taxi Company and Sam Mikulich owner of Goodfellow's Grill 17 Fremont Street being
given to said taxi companies for the 20ft parking space. Police Department directed to paint
said strips the proper color.

Vote on said motion was as follows: Commissioners Mundy and German and his Honor the
Mayor voting Aye. Noes none.

It was called to the attention of the Board at this time that a number of property
owners in Pioneer and Fairview Additions to the City of Las Vegas had erected fences across
alleys belonging to the City of Las Vegas.

On motion of Commissioner Mundy seconded by Commissioner German it was moved and
carried that the City attorney be instructed to to draw up and serve a formal notice to any
property owners infringing on City property and serve same.

Vote on said motion was as follows; Commissioners Mundy, German, and His Honor the
Mayor voting aye. Noes none.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting then

adjourned.
