Minutes of a Special called meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las
Vegas held on the 7th day of January 1935 at the hour of three o'clock P.M.

Roll call showed the following present, Mayor Cragin, Commissioners Arnett, German and
Marble, City Attorney Henderson and City Clerk Viola Burns.

Absent Commissioner Down.

 At this time the Board took under consideration the leasing of a parcel of land to the
American Legion P st No. 8 upon which a War Memorial Building would be erected in the near
future.	 

After due consideration on the matter on motion of Commissioner Arnett seconded by
Commissioner Marble the following Resolution was duly adopted:

WHEREAS, Las Vegas Post Number 8, The American Legion, Department of Nevada, has hereto-
fore requested the City of Las Vegas to lease a parcel of land within the exterior bound-
aries of the City Park, for the purpose of constructing a War Memorial Building, and

THE MATTER having heretofore been considered in all its phases by this Board, and
IT APPEARING to the Board that such a building will meet the long existing demand for such
a structure, and that it will be of great benefit to the city and community, and good cause
appearing therefor,

IT IS ORDERED AND DIRECTED, that the Mayor and City Clerk convey to Las Vegas Post
Number 8, the American Legion, Department of Nevada, the following described premises:

Commencing at the northeast corner of Block Thirty-three (33) of
Clark's Las Vegas Townsite as per map of said Townsite on file
and of record in the office of the County Recorder of Clark County,

Nevada, thence along the prolongation of the easterly line of said
Block 33, N. 28˚13' E. eighty (80) feet to the point of beginning:
thence N. 61˚47' W. 275.0 feet; thence N. 28˚13' E. 300.0 feet; thence N.

68˚01' 20" E. 117.15; thence S. 61˚47' E. 200.0 feet; thence S. 28˚	

13' W. 390.0 feet to the point of beginning, comprising a net area of
2.385 acres.

by appropriate lease for a period of fifty (50) years, at the annual rental thereon of
$1.00 per annum, payable annually in advance.

That the said lease contain appropriate provisions for the termination thereof upon the
happening of any of the following contingencies:

(1) Failure of the Las Vegas Post Number 8, the American Legion, Department of Nev-
ada, to construct a Memorial Building upon the said premises, of a value in excess of
fifteen Thousand Dollars, ($15,000.00) on or before the first day of January, 1936.

(2)	Upon dissolution of said Post of the American Legion, for any reason.

(3)	At any such time as the membership of said Las Vegas Post Number 8 of the American
Legion, Department of Nevada, shall not contain at least ten (lO) members who are veterans

of the World War.

Vote on the Resolution was as follows: Commissioners Arnett, German, and Marble, and
His Honor the Mayor E.W. Cragin voting aye. Noes none.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting adjourned.

Minutes of a special meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas, held
at the office of the City Clerk in	the City	of Las Vegas, Clark	County, Nevada, this	14th day of

January, 1935 at the hour of seven	P.M., in	accordance with the	call and notice duly	given a

copy of which is on file and of record in this office.

Present: Commissioners Arnett, German, Down and Marble, end His Honor the Mayor
E.W.Cragin; also the City Clerk and City Attorney.

At this time the Mayor stated	the purpose of the call to be	the consideration of	the City

making application to the N E R A for funds	with which to construct what is known as	the Las

Vegas War Memorial Building, on the land embraced in the City Park, the Mayor stating that
heretofore it was the understanding that the project could have been started and completed on
the application of Las Vegas Post No. 8 The American Legion, Department of Nevada, and in
accordance with said understanding the City had leased a portion of said City Park Premises
to said American Legion Post, permission to enter into said lease and to erect thereon a
War Memorial Building having been granted to the City by the grantor of said land, to-wit:

Las Vegas Land & Water Company; and it now appearing that in order that said project may be started
and completed under the requirements of the N E R A, the said project must be under the super-
visions of, and the application thereof made by a political subdivision, and whereas the City is
without funds to build the building, but the American Legion Post has the available funds to
buy the materials therefor, with the understanding that the said N.E.R.A. is to provide the
necessary labor; and the City Commissioner believing that a War Memorial Building
with a civic auditorium would be an asset to the City and a building that is much needed by the
City; and whereas, in order that the same may be built, the said American Legion has this day
entered into an agreement with the said City surrendering the lease heretofore given, and
agreeing to donate to the City under certain conditions, sufficient monies with which to pur-
chase the necessary materials for construction of the said building; and whereas
said lease has been surrendered and said agreement between the said American Legion Post and the
said City of Las Vegas duly executed,

Upon motion of Commissioner Down, duly made, seconded by Commissioner Arnett, it is

RESOLVED, that the Mayor and City Clerk of the City of Las Vegas, Clark County, Nevada, be
and they are hereby authorized and directed to make application to the ^ E R A for the nec-
essary funds to erect what is to be known as a War Memorial Building, on the City Park Premises;

BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED, that the Mayor and City Clerk be and they are hereby authorized to
sign on behalf of the City of Las Vegas, and to affix the seal of said City thereto, the application
to be made for said project:

BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED, that the City Clerk be, and she is hereby directed to attach to
said application a certified copy of this Resolution.

Vote on said Resolution was as follows: Commissioners Arnett, Marble, German and Down and
His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes none.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting then adjourned.

provide for the payment of the lights.

At this time the Board of Commissioners entered into a discussion on the proposed
amendments to the City Charter which would be presented to the State Legislature now in session.
After some discussion on the matter on motion of Commissioner Arnett seconded by Commissioner
Marble it was moved and carried that at least two members of the Board of Commissioners with the
City Attorney and Clerk accompany said charter amendments to Carson City, and present same to
the Clark County Deligation siting in the Senate and Assembly. Expenses of trip to be paid
by the City of Las Vegas.

Vote was as follows: Commissioners Arnett Marble German and Down and His Honor the
Mayor voting aye. Noes none.

At number of persons interested in "Keno" and "Tango" in the City of Las Vegas appear-
ed before the Board at this time in regard to, the manner in which the said games might be oper-
ated. After a lengthy discussion on the matter on motion of Commissioner Down seconded by Commissioner
 Marble it was moved and carried that the games both Tango and Keno operate on the same
bases, that is not having a set price for the "pot" but paying the public 85% of the money
taken in at each roll and the house maintaining 15%, and that cards must sell for a uniform
price for each and every roll of said games. Vote was as follows: Commissioners Arnett,

Marble, German and Down and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes none.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting recessed
until Friday the 8th day of February at which time the Boy Scouts of America would have a
delegation present to attend said meeting it being "National Boy Scout Week."

FEBRUARY 21st, 1935.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas
Nevada, held on Thursday the 21st day of February 1935 at the hour of three o'clock P.M.

Roll call showed the following present Mayor Pro Tem German, Commissioners Marble, and Down
together with the Deputy City Attorney Geo. Marshall, and City Clerk, Viola Burns.

Absent Mayor Cragin and Commissioner Arnett and City Attorney Henderson.

Dr. W.S. Park appeared before the Board in regard to the City entering into a public works
programme in the form of a municipal golf course for the City of Las Vegas. After some discussion
on the matter on motion of Commissioner Marble seconded by commissioner Down it was moved and
carried that the City enter into such a programme with the N.E.R.A. if the cost of materials and
the ground to be used could be secured without too much expense to the City.

Vote was as follows, Commissioners Marble, and Down and Mayor Pro Tem German voting aye. Noes

none.

Thereupon Mayor Pro Tem German appointed the following committee to investigate the matter
and report to the Board at its	next	regular recessed meeting	to be held on	Monday the 25th of

February, 1935 at the hour of seven	thirty o'clock P.M.

Committee composed of the following J.P. King, A.R.Thompson, W.S. Park, A.C.Grant and J.N.
Jefferies.

On motion of Commissioner Marble seconded by Commissioner Down it was moved and carried that
5½% beverage licenses be granted to J.W. Jacobus 20 Stewart St. and to Carl Ray 421 Fremont St;
Applications being in proper form and money in file with the Clerk to cover the same.

Vote was as follows, Commissioners Marble, and Down and His Honor the Mayor Pro Tem voting
Aye. Noes none.

On motion of Commissioner	Down	seconded by Commissioner	Marble it was	moved and carried that

a tavern license for 104 North	1st St. be grant J.H. Morgan.	Application being in proper form	and

money on file with the Clerk to cover the same.

Vote was as follows, Commissioners Marble, and Down and Mayor Pro Tem German voting aye.

Noes none.

that the following slot machine licenses be granted:

Vote was as follows: Commissioners Marble, and Down and Mayor Pro Tem German voting aye.

Noes none.

H. Case, Chief of the Las Vegas Fire Dept appeared before the Board in regard to the City
having a fire marshall, and the salary for such officer.

After some discussion the Board took the matter under advisement.
At this time Frank Silva, Director of the N.E.R.A. appeared before the Board in regard to
two "public works" programmes for the City of Las Vegas, Nevada.

No. 1. The improvement of the following streets:

11th Street from Fremont Street to Mesquite Street.

12th Street from Fremont Street to Stewart Street
Ogden Street from 11th to 13th Street.

	Said improving to consist of the grading of the above mentioned streets to the proper street

grade, and the placing of gravel thereon to provide better drainage for the district effected.

No. 2 The improving of the ball ground and the grounds used for public playgrounds on the
City park site on Stewart Street from Second to Fifth Street.

On motion of Commissioner Marble seconded by Commissioner Down it was moved and carried
that the City enter into the above mentioned projects with the N.E.R.A. and that the sum of
$2,172.00 be allowed for materials to be used on the streets to be improved, and that the sum of
$725.00 be allowed for the purchasing of materials to be used in the improving of the public
playground.

Vote was as follows, Commissioners Marble, and Down and Mayor Pro Tem German voting aye.
Noes none.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting recessed until
Monday the 25th day of February, 1935 at the hour of seven thirty o'clock P.M.

Approved:

Mayor Pro Tem.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK, CITY OF
LAS VEGAS, CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

FEBRUARY 25th, 1935.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the City of Las Vegas held on February 25th, 1935
at the hour seven thirty o'clock P.M.

Roll call showed the follow ng present Mayor Cragin, Commissioners Arnett, Marble, German
and Down, Deputy City Attorney Marshall and City Clerk.

Absent City Attorney Henderson.

At this time the Board entered into a lenghty discussion on the various "public works"
programmes that might be carried on in the City of Las Vegas, which with the held of the N.E.R.A.
would greatly relieve the unemployed situation at the present and in the near future for the
City of Las Vegas.

A number of interested citizens were present including Earl Davidson, Chairman of the Clark Co;
Board of Commissioners, Claude Mackey in charge of the relief depot in the City, F.C.DeVinney
Assessor.

Dr. Park and J.P. King presented to the Board the report of the committee appointed to
investigate the matter of having the City install a municipal golf course.

On motion of Commissioner Marble seconded by Commissioner Down it was moved and carried that
the City Board of Commissioners accept the report of the said Committee add that the City enter
into an agreement with the N.E.R.A. for the installation of a municipal golf course and carry
out said project as far as possible.

Vote was as follows, Commissioners Arnett, Marble, German and Down and His Honor the Mayor
voting aye. Noes none.

No definite action was taken on any other proposed "public works" project at this time.

On motion of Commissioner Arnett seconded by Commissioner Marble it was moved and carried
that Adam's Cash and Carry Grocery be granted a retail beverage 5½% , license at 1016 Fremont.
Application being in proper form and money on file with the clerk to cover the same.

Vote was as follows, Commissioners Arnett, Marble, German and Down and His Honor the Mayor
voting aye. Noes none.

At this time: the Commission considered the matter of writing in the form of a Resolution
to the Congressional representatives in Washington to secure aid in caring for the unemployed
in the City of Las Vegas.	Approved:

After some discussion on the matter on motion duly made seconded and carried the follow-
ing Preambles and Resolution were duly adopted:	Mayor.

That it appears that the City of Las Vegas has general obligation bonds outstanding
in the sum of approximately $230,000.00;

That the total taxable property of the City of Las Vegas, Nevada is the sum of $660,000.00:

That the statutory limitation as expressed in the Charter of the City of Las Vegas pro-
hibits said City from issuing any general obligation bonds in a sum greater than twenty per cent
(20%) of the taxable property of said city; that therefore said city can not at this time
issue any general obligation bonds for the purpose of carrying on work projects or buying mat-
erials therefor;
That for the year 1935, said City of Las Vegas received for its use and governmental
purposes the sum of $1.50 per hundred dollars of valuation as tax money; that the said sum
of $1.50 is the limit said City may obtain; that the tax rate for the year 1935 in said City
of Las Vegas, including State and County, was the sum of $4.64 per hundred dollars of val-
uation; that the Legislature of the State of Nevada recently passed a bill increasing the
state taxes nine cents;

That it is apparent that the Board of County Commissioners, whose duty it is to made
apportionments, are of the opinion and firmly convinced that due to the order of Congress
and the President, that the burdens to Clark County will increase for relief in the sum of
approximately Four Thousand Dollars per month, thereby increasing the burden of the County of
Clark, State of Nevada, from the present expenditure for indigent relief from $36,000.00
per annum to approximately $84, 000.00 per annum;

That said	City	of	Las Vegas,	by and through its Board of Commissioners, has been noti-
fied	and informed that	it is very	doubtful whether or not the City would be allowed more than

$1.30 in its next budget for governmental purposes;

That due to the completion of Boulder Dan, it is estimated that approximately one
thousand persons, having gained sufficient residence in the County of Clark, will be added to
the relief rolls of both the City of Las Vegas and the County of Clark;

That due to the completion of Boulder Dam, the taxable property of the City of Las Vegas
has decreased approximately $60,000.00;

That said	City	is	financially unable to carry on any relief projects whatsoever where

a prerequisite	will	be	a purchase	of materials; that unless aid by way of donation is granted

to said City of Las Vegas, it will be wholly physically impossible to care for its unfort-
unate residents who are without work;

That at the present time here are eligible in the City of Las Vegas and County of Clark
four hundred sixty-five worable idle persons; that to date said City of Las Vegas and County
of Clark have done all in their power to raise money to carry on the work projects, and that
all projects in the City of Las Vegas heretofore commenced will be finished within the course
of thirty days.

WHEREFORE, the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas resolve as follows:

BE IT RESOLVED, that this Resolution be forwarded, one to each of the Congressional
representatives, that is to say: the Honorable Key Pittman, the Honorable James G.
Scrugham, and the Honorable Patrick McCarran ; and that said Representatives in Congress
are requested to do all in their power to provide relief for the City of Las Vegas,
County of Clark, State of Nevada, so that the unfortunate unemployed may be cared for
without creating any extra burden to the said City of Las Vegas.

The vote oh the above and foregoing resolution was as follows: Commissioners W.C.German,
H.P. Marble, James H. Down and Leonard Arnett, and His Honor the Mayor E.W.Cragin; Noes none.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting then adjourned.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK, CITY OF
LAS VEGAS, CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

  MARCH 15th, 1935.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas
held on the 15th day of March, 1935.

Boll call showed the following present, Mayor Cragin, Commissioners Arnett, Marble, and
Down City Attorney and City Clerk.

Absent Commissioner German.
At this time the Board took up the matter of providing for the General City Election to be
held on the 7th day of May, 1935, for the purpose of electing a mayor and two City Commissioners
for the City of Las Vegas. Thereupon, on motion of Commissioner Arnett seconded by Commissioner
Down, the following Preamble and Resolution was duly adopted:

There as, under the provisions of Section 3 Chapter 11 of the Charter of the City of Las
Vegas, Nevada, as amended by the Legislature of the State of Nevada, in the year 1929, a
General City Election must be held on the first Tuesday after the first Monday in May,

1933, and it appearing therefrom that such election should be called and prepared for,

NOW THEREFORE,

BE IT RESOLVED, that a General City Election be and the same is hereby ordered to be
held in said City of Las Vegas on the 7th day of May, 1935 for the purpose of electing
a mayor and two Commissioner, namely: a Commissioner of the 1st and a commissioner of the
3rd class, at the places hereinafter set forth.

BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED that for the purpose of complying with the provisions of said Section
3 Chapter 11 of said Charter of said City of Las Vegas, as amended in 1923, said City of
Las Vegas be and is hereby divided into eleven election precincts, as follows:

Precinct No. 1, which is bounded on the north by the northern limit of the City of Las
Vegas; on the east by the center line of Fifth Street from the northern limit of said
City, south to the center of Stewart Street, thence west along the center line of Stewart
Street to the center of Third Street, thence south along the center line of Third Street
to the center of Fremont Street, and on the south by the center line of Fremont Street and
a continuation thereof from the center of Third Street to the right-of-way of the Union
Pacific Railroad, and on the west by the said right-of-way of said Union Pacific Railroad
from the center of Fremont Street to the northern city limit.

Precinct No. 2, Which is bounded as follows: Beginning at the point where Clark Avenue
in the Original Townsite of Las Vegas intersects the eastern line of the Union Pacific
right-of-way, south along the said boundary of the said right-of-way to a continuation
of	the	center	line of Fremont Street;	thence east along the	center line of Fremont Street

to	the	center	of Third Street; thence	south along the center	line of Third Street to the

Center of Bridger Street; thence west along the the center line of Bridger Street to the
eastern boundary of the Union Pacific right-of-way; thence south along said boundary of
of said right-of-way to the center of Charleston Boulevard; thence, west along the center
of Charleston Boulevard to the Southeast corner of the SW¼ of Section 33, Township 20S
Range 61 E., M.D.B & M.: thence north along the center line of the said Section 33, Town-
ship 20 S. Range 61 E., M.D.B.& M. to the NE corner of the SE¼ of the NW¼ of Section 33,
Township 20 S., Range 61 E., thence wet to the western limit of the City of Las Vegas;
thence north along the western limits of said city to the NW corner of the SW¼ of the SW¼
of	Section 30	Township 20 S. Range 61	E., thence west along	the line from the said corner

to	the	center	line of Clark Avenue; thence along the center	line of Clark Avenue to the

point of beginning.

Precinct No. 3, which is bounded on the north by the center line of Bridger Street; on
the east by the center line of Third Street; on the south by the center line of Clark
Street, and on the west by the Union Pacific right-of-way.

Precinct No. 4, which is bounded on the north by the center line of Clark Street; on
the east by the center line of Third Street; on the south by the center line of Garces
Street, and on the west by the Union Pacific right-of-way.

Precinct No. 5, which is bounded as follows: Beginning at the point where the center
line of Fifth Street intersects the northern	limit of the City of Las Vegas, east

along the said northern limit of said city to the eastern limit of said city; thence
south along said eastern limit to the point where Croissant Street intersects the said
eastern limit of the said city; thence west along the said Croissant Street to the center
of State Street; thence south along the center line of State Street to the center of Oak
Street; thence west along the northern boundary of Buck's Subdivision of the City of Las
Vegas to the center of Seventh Street; thence south along the center of Seventh Street
to the center of Fremont Street; thence west along the center line of Fremont Street to
the center line of Third Street; thence north along the center line of Third Street to the
center of Stewart Street; thence east along the center line of of Stewart Street to the
center of Fifth Street; thence north along the center line of Fifth Street to the point
of beginning.

Precinct No. 6, which is bounded on the north by the center line of Fremont Street: on the
east by the intersection of Fremont Street and Charleston Boulevard; on the south by
Charleston Boulevard from said intersection west to the southwest corner of Harrison
Acres and a line running from said southwest corner of Harrison Acres to the intersection
of Bridger and Fifteenth Streets and the center line of Bridger Street; and on the west
by the center line of Third Street.

Precinct No. 7, which is bounded on the north by the center line of Bridger Street from the
center of Third Street east to the intersection of Fifteenth and Bridger Streets and by a
line from the said intersection of the southwest corner of Harrison Acres; on the south
by the center line of Charleston Boulevard from the southwest corner of Harrison Acres

BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED that no candidate for office at such election shall be entitles to
have his name placed placed upon the official ballot unless such candidate shall, not more
than fifty days nor less then thirty days before the date of election, file in the office of
the City Clerk of said City of Las Vegas, Nevada, a petition of nomination, in writing, con-
taining the name of the person nominated, the office for which he is nominated, and setting
forth his qualification as required by Section 6 Chapter 11 of the City Charter of said City
of Las Vegas. Such petition shall be subscribed and sworn to by the candidate nominated: and
there shall be charged each candidate, for filing such petition of nomination, a fee of $5.00
which shall be paid to the City Clerk at the time of filing and for the General Fund of said
City.

BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED that the City Clerk of said City be, and she is, hereby authorized and
directed t notify the County Clerk of Clark County, Nevada, to open registration for the
registration of voters of said City of Las Vegas for said General City Election at the time
and in the manner provided by laws of the state of Nevada, governing the registration of votes
such registration to open on the 18th day of March, 1935, and close on the 16th day of April
1935.
BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED that the City Clerk of the City of Las Vegas be and she is hereby
authorized and directed to have official ballots prepared and to do and perform all such
other or further acts, and give such notices as may be necessary or required by the charter
of said City or by the general election laws of the State of Nevada, in order that said
election may be called and held, and that the qualified voters of said City may have due
notice thereof.

BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED that all provisions of the general election laws of the State of
Nevada, so far as the same may be applicable and not inconsistent with the said City Charter
of the said City of Las Vegas, shall be observed in conducting said election.

BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED, that the Mayor, or Mayor Pro. Tem. of said City of Las Vegas, be
and he is hereby authorized an directed to issue a proclamation giving notice of the holding
of said election, and that such proclamation contain the information necessary to fairly
apprize the qualified voters of said City of Las Vegas of the date, time and place of holding
and purposes of said election.

BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED, THAT SUCH PROCLAMATION BE PUBLISHED IN THE Las Vegas Review-Journal,
a daily newspaper printed and published in the City of Las Vegas, County of Clark, State of
Neva a, for one issue not less than six weeks prior to the date of such election,

he ballot at such election shall contain such further questions as may properly submitted
to the vote of the qualified electors of said City.

The vote on said Resolution was as follows: Commissioners Arnett, Marble and Down and His
Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes none.

At this time the appointing of two members of the Planning Commission was brought before
the Board.

On motion of Commissioner Arnett seconded by Commissioner Marble it was moved and carried
that J.P. King and A.C. Granted be appointed to serve on the Planning Commission. Said terms
to expire May 25th, 1938.

Vote was as follows; Commissioners Arnett, Marble and Down and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye. Noes none.

On motion of Commissioner Arnett seconded by Commissioner Marble it was moved and
carried that the City call for bids on a fire truck. That the specifications for said fire
truck be prepared by H. Case, chief of the Las Vegas Fire Dept.

Vote was as follows: Commissioners Arnett, Marble, and Down and His Honor the Mayor
voting aye. Noes none.

The business of having the Fire Marshall paid by the City of Las Vegas was next presented
to the Board, and on motion of Commissioner Marble seconded by Commissioner Arnett it was
moved and carried that Leon Rockwell, Fire Marshall of the City of Las Vegas be placed on a
salary of $100.00 per months for two months. That is to say from the 10th day of March, 1935,
to the 20th day of May, 1935, to take care of fire hazards now existing in the City of Las
Vegas.

Vote was as follows: Commissioners Arnett, Marble, and Down and His Honor the Mayor
voting aye. Noes none.

On motion of Commissioner Arnett seconded by Commissioner Marble it was moved and
carried that the beverage license granted to Lee Shelly be transferred to Chris C. Giesecke.
Application appeared in proper form.

Vote on said motion was as follows: Commissioners Arnett, Marble and Down and His
Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes none.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting recessed until
Friday March 22nd, 1935.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK, CITY OF LAS VEGAS,
CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

MARCH 22nd, 1935.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las
Vegas, Clark County, Nevada, held on the 22nd of March 1935 at the hour of three o'clock P.M.

Roll call showed the following present, Mayor Cragin, Commissioners Arnett, German,
and Down and Marble, City Attorney and Clerk.

At this time a petition was presented to the Board signed by a number of tavern owners
asking that the hours for the playing of music in taverns be extended from 2 o'clock A.M. to
four o'clock A.M. Said petition was turned to W.C. German, Police and Fire Commissioners and
he was directed to have the matter investigated by the police department to ascertain if it
would be tb the best interest of the parties interested to change said hours.

At this time the signing of the contract for the supplying of the City with lamps for
the various departments was considered, and the awarding of said contract was turned to
Jas. H. Down, Commissioner of Water, Sewer and Lights.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting recessed until
Monday the first day of April, 1935 at the hour of three o'clock P.M.
OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK, CITY OF LAS VEGAS
CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

APRIL 1st, 1935.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of City Commissioners of the City of
Las Vegas held on the 1st day of April, 1935 at the hour of three o'clock P.M.

Roll call showed the following present, Mayor Cragin, Commissioners Arnett, Marble, and
Down, City Attorney and Clerk.

Absent Commissioner German.

he Board took under consideration at this time the placing of the question of municipal
ownership on the ballot at the coming general City Election.

On motion of Commissioner Arnett, seconded by Commissioner Down the following Resolution
was duly adopted:

RESOLVED: That, pursuant to the authority in this Board vested, the question of whether or not
the duly qualified Electors of said City are in favor of a municipally owned electric power and
light plant and system for the furnishing and distribution of electric power and energy to and
for the inhabitants of said City, and the creation and maintenance of same, be placed on the
ballot and submitted to the duly qualified Electors of said City for approval or disapproval
at the General City Election to be held on Tuesday the 7th day of May, 1935, and

BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED: That, the City Clerk be and she is hereby ordered and directed to
have printed on said ballot said question in the following form:

Do you favor the proposition of and so direct the Board of City Commissioners
and proper officials of the City of Las Vegas, Nevada, to create or acquire and
maintain a municipally owned electric power and light plant and system for the
sale and distribution of electric power and energy to the inhabitants of the
City of Las Vegas, Nevada?

YES__________________

NO__________________

Vote on the foregoing resolution was Commissioners Arnett, Down and Marble, and His Honor
the Mayor voting aye. Noes none.

At this time the Clerk presented to the Board a petition signed by a number of property
owners asking that no provision be made for the opening of a funeral home at 511 Fremont Street.
Also a number of interested persons appeared in person asking that the operation of such business
be prohibited in said district.

On motion of Commissioner Marble, Seconded by Commissioner Arnett it was moved and carried
that said petition be placed on file until the matter was considered at a meeting to be held
on the 5th day of April, 1935.

Vote was as follows: Commissioners Arnett, Marble and Down and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye. Noes none.

On motion of Arnett seconded by Commissioner Marble it was moved and carried that the follow-
ing liquor licenses be granted:

(5½%) license fee $10.00 per quarter

Read City Drug and Fountain Grill retail liquor stores sealed packages only fee $500.00 per
quarter year.

Outpost Trading Company wholesale beverage license $25.00 per quarter year.

Vote on the motion was Commissioners Arnett, Marble and Down and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye. Noes none.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK, CITY OF LAS VEGAS
CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

APRIL 4th, 1935.

Minutes of a regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas held on
the 4th day of April, 1935 at the hour of three o'clock P.M.

Answering roll call were Mayor Cragin, Commissioners Arnett, Down, German and Marble, City
attorney and City Clerk.

All claims allowed as per claims and warrant register on file in the office of the Clerk.

Reports of City Clerk and Municipal Judge approved by the Mayor.

The Board at once entered into a discussion on the matter of submitting the question of
municipal ownership to the electors at the coming General City Election as was passed at the
recessed regular meeting held on Monday the 1st day of April, 1935, and after some discussion on
the matter on motion of Commissioner Arnett seconded by Commissioner Marble, that the action of
the Board of City Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas in the adoption of a resolution on the
first day of April 1935, at a recessed regular meeting submitting to the electors of said City
the question of whether or not they were in favor of the creation or acquiring of a municipally
owned power plant for the distribution of electric power to the inhabitants of said City is
hereby approved;

Vote on said motion was as follows, Commissioners Arnett, Marble, German and Down and His
Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes none.

At this time the Board took under consideration the purchasing of a fire truck and at
the direction of the Mayor the Clerk opened the bids, of the Mack Motor Corporation, The American
LaFrance Corporation, and the Seagreaves Corporation.

H. Case, Chief of the Las Vegas Fire Dept. and being present was ask to make recommend-
ation to the Board as to the truck he thought the best and must suitable for use in the City of
Las Vegas. His recommendation was the Seagreaves Fire Truck.

On motion of Commissioner Down seconded by Commissioner Arnett it was moved and carried that
the Board act on the recommendation of W.C. German, Police and Fire Commissioner in the selection
of the fire truck purchase.

Vote was as follows: Commissioners Arnett, German, Down Marble and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye. Noes none.

On motion of Commissioner Arnett seconded by Commissioner Down it was moved and carried that
the City purchase a Seagraves fire truck. Recommendation for purchase of said truck being made to
the Board by W.C. German, Police and Fire Commissioner and that the price be $6,500.00 less 5% foo
cash on delivery. Delivery to be in sixty days. The Mayor and City Clerk to be directed to enter
into said contract with Seagraves Corporation.

Vote was as follows Commissioners Arnett, Down, German and Marble and His Honor the Mayor
voting aye. Noes none.

The purchase of new fire hose was also considered at this time and on motion of Commissioner
German seconded by Commissioner Marble it was moved and carried that the City call for bids on the
purchase of one thousand feet of fire hose and that Fire Chief Case prepare the specifications,
and that such bids be opened on May the 4th, 1935.

Vote was as follows, Commissioners Arnett, Down, German and Marble and His Honor the Mayor
voting aye. Noes none.

On motion of Commissioner Arnett seconded by Commissioner Marble it was moved and carried
that W.B. Ross, Pete Peccole and The La Tavern be granted tavern licenses. Applications being in
proper form and money on file with the City Clerk to cover the same.

voting aye. Noes none.

behalf as did Leo McNamee, Mr. Luce of Luce and Goodfellow, Mr. Martin, from Art Candee Co.

Mrs. Harry Anderson was present and opposed the opening of said business in said location.

Arnett it was moved	and carried that the City Clerk be directed	to write	the	Las Vegas Chamber

of Commerce and ask	for recommendation from that body as to the	district	for	locating mortuaries,

and the amending of the City Zoning Ordinance allowing mortuaries outside the Industrial
district.

Vote was as follows, Commissioners Arnett, Marble, and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK, CITY OF LAS VEGAS
CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

APRIL 10th, 1935.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las
Vegas held on the 10th day of April, 1935 at the hour of three o'clock P.M.

The following answered roll call, Mayor Cragin, Commissioners Arnett, Marble, German and
Down, City Attorney and Clerk.

Mr. Garrison again appeared before the Board in regard to the amending of the City
Zoning Ordinance allowing mortuaries outside the Industrial District. After some discussion
on the matter Mr. Garrison was informed that the Board would consider the placing of mortuaries
in the commercial district, and set April 19th, 1935 at the time in which said amendment would
be considered.

On motion of Commissioner Arnett seconded by Commissioner Marble it was moved and carried
to donate the sum of one hundred dollars from the Publicity Fund towards the transportation of
fish from hatcheries to Boulder Dam Lake.

Vote was as follows, Commissioners Arnett, Marble, German and Down and His Honor the
Mayor voting aye. Noes none.

On motion of Commissioner Down seconded by Commissioner Marble it was moved and carried
that the following slot machine licenses be granted. All applications being in form and money
on file with the Clerk covering the same.

L.L. Arnett	34	machines

E.P. Bihlmaier	23	machines

E.D.Ciliax	3	Machines

W.J. Lincoln	1	machine

Professional Pharmacy	2	machines'

A.H. Stevenson	1	machine

Vegas Sweet Shoppe	7	machines

J.T. Watters	3	machines

White Spot Cafe	3	machines

Vote was as follows, Commissioners Arnett, Marble, German and Down and His Honor the Mayor
voting aye. Noes none.

On motion of Commissioner Arnett seconded by Commissioner Down it was moved and
carried that a beverage license be granted to Edward Scott at 310 No. 2nd St. Application
being in proper form and money to cover same on file with the clerk.
Vote was as follows, Commissioners Arnett, German, Down and Marble and His Honor the Mayor
voting aye. Noes none.

At this time the Board took under consideration the publishing of the list of voters at the
coming City Election. As this is not required by law at a City election it was on motion of
Commissioner German seconded by Commissioner Marble moved and carried that the list of voters
in the City of Las Vegas be published owing to the large number of new registrations which
would aid in the placing of voters election day.

The vote was as follows, Commissioners Arnett, Marble, German and Down and His Honor the
Mayor voting aye. Noes none.

At this time the Board was presented with a petition signed by a number of tavern owners
asking that gaming be allowed in places where liquors were sold and served. Attorney Louis
Cohen appeared in behalf of the tavern owners. No action was taken on the matter at this time.
at the request of Attorney Cohen.

No further business appearing before the Board the meeting then recessed until Friday the
19th day of April, 1935 at the hour of three o'clock P.M.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK CITY OF LAS VEGAS,

CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

APRIL 19th, 1935.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of
Las Vegas, Clark County, Nevada, held on the 19th day of April, 1935 at the hour of three
o'clock P.M.

Roll call showed the following present Mayor Cragin, Commissioners Arnett, Marble, and
Down, Deputy City Attorney Marshall, and City Clerk.

Absent Commissioner German.

At this time the Board entered into the discussion of the prepared amendment to the City
Zoning Ordinance and the districts involved with the City Engineer A.R. Thompson, and after
reaching a decision as to the zoning of the City the following ordinance was introduced and
passed as an emergency ordinance:

"An Ordinance to amend Section II, and Section III, as amended, and section V, as amended,

Of ordinance No. 168, entitled, "An ordinance of the Commission of the City of Las Vegas, estab-
lishing a residence district, industrial and commercial districts within the said City of Las
Vegas; defining such districts: declaring it unlawful to erect, establish, maintain, or operate
certain factories, works, or establishments within said residence districts and said commercial
districts; regulating the erection, establishment, maintenance, operation and rebuilding of
certain works or establishments in said districts; providing penalties for the violation of said
ordinance, and repealing ordinances in conflict herewith."

Vote on the passage and adoption of said ordinance was as follows: Commissioners Arnett,
Marble, and Down and His Honor the Mayor Cragin voting aye. Noes none.

The City Clerk was then directed to have said ordinance published in the Las Vegas Age,

a weekly newspaper published in the City of Las Vegas, for a period of two consecutive weeks.

hat is to say once each week for two weeks, namely April 19th and 26th, 1935 and said ordinance
to be known as Ordinance No. 214, and to be in full force and effect from and after May 4th, 1935.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting then recessed
until Friday the 3rd day of May, 1935 at the hour of three o'clock P.M.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK CITY OF
LAS VEGAS, CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

APRIL 19th, 1935.

Minutes of a	recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the	City	of Las

Vegas held on the	19th day of April at the hour of	three o'clock P.M.

Present to answer roll call were Mayor Cragin, Commissioners Arnett, Marble and Down,
Deputy City Attorney Marshall and City Clerk.

Absent Commissioner German.

At this time	the Clerk presented to the Board	for consideration a number of	slot	machine

applications, and	upon motion of Commissioner Down	seconded by Commissioner Marble it	was moved

that said applications for slot machine licenses be granted as the applications were in proper
form and money on file with the Clerk to cover the same.

Vote was as follows: Commissioners Arnett, Marble and Down and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye. Noes none.
" An Ordinance to amend section II, Section III, as amended, and Section V, as amended, of
Ordinance No. 168, entitled, "An ordinance of the Commission of the City of Las Vegas, establish-
ing a residence district, industrial and commercial districts within the City of Las Vegas;
defining such districts; declaring it unlawful to erect, establish, maintain, or operate certain
factories, works or establishments within said residence districts and said commercial dis-
tricts; regulating the erection, establishment, maintenance, operation and rebuilding of certain
works or establishments in said districts; providing penalties for the violation of said or-
dinance,	and repealing ordinances in conflict herewith," was	read	for	a first	and second time

and passed as and emergency	ordinance upon the second reading	upon	the	following vote: 

Commissioners Arnett, Marble, and Down and His Honor the Mayor Cragin voting aye. Noes none.

The City Clerk was directed to have said Ordinance No. 214 published in the Las Vegas
Age, a daily newspaper printed and published in the City of Las Vegas for two weeks, that is to
say April	19th and 26th and	said ordinance would be effective	May 4th,	1935.

No	further business appearing before the Board at this	time	the	meeting	recessed until

Friday the 3rd day of May, 1935 at the hour of three o'clock P.M.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK, CITY OF LAS VEGAS
CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

MAY 3rd, 1935.

 Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las
Vegas held on the 3rd day of May, 1935 at the hour of three o'clock P.M.

Roll call showed the following present Mayor Cragin, Commissioners Arnett, Marble, and
Down City Attorney and Deputy City Clerk.

Absent Commissioner German, and City Clerk. (Temporary leave for the voting of absent
voters).

All claims allowed as per claims and warrant register on file in the office of the Clerk.
No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting adjourned.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK CITY OF
LAS VEGAS, CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

MAY 4th, 1935.

Minutes of a regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas
held on the 4th day of May, 1935 at the hour of three o'clock P.M.

Roll call showed the follow ng present Mayor Cragin, Commissioners German, Marble,
and Down, City Attorney Henderson and City Clerk Viola Burns.

Absent Commissioner Arnett.

On motion of Commissioner Marble seconded by Commissioner German it was moved and carried
that the following gaming and slot machine licenses be granted:

Avalon Novelty Company 2 Exhibit Digger Machines
E.P. Bihlmaier	1 Slot Machine

L.L. Arnett	2	"	"

Las Vegas Sweet Shoppe	4	"	"

Silver Club one each Roulette, Craps and and Twenty-one.

Applications all being in proper form and money on file with the Clerk to cover the same.

Vote was as follows, Commissioners Marble, German and Down and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye. Noes none.

At this time the Board took under consideration the purchasing of one thousand feet of
fire hose. Bids having been issued by the Clerk under the direction of Fire Chief Case. A number
of bids having been received the Clerk was directed to open same by the Mayor.	

After due consideration on all bids presented to the Board on motion of Commissioner German
Seconded by Commissioner Marble it was moved and carried that the City purchase one thousand feet of
fire hose from the Eureka Fire Hose Mfg. Co. Price for same being $1.30 per foot. Delivery of
same to be in thirty days. That the Mayor and the Clerk enter into a contract with said company
for the delivery of said hose and that cash be paid for the same upon delivery.

Vote was as follows, Commissioners Marble, German and Down and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye. Noes none.
A number of persons interested in forming an association to promote horse racing in the City
were present and ask the co-operation of the City in the building of a race track at what is known
as the City Park Grounds. The name of the said association being the Clark County Horse Breeders
Association. No definite action was taken tut the Board assured the representation that they
would assist them in every way possible.

It was brought to the attention of the members of the Board that the Six Companies in Boulder
City, Nevada were disposing of used building materials at a very reasonable price. Upon motion
of Commissioner Marble seconded by Commissioner German it was moved and carried that J.P. King
Supt. of streets negotiate with the Six Companies for the purchase of LOOO railroad ties @ 15¢
each.

Vote was as follows Commissioners Marble German and Down and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes none.

On motion of Commissioner Down seconded by Commissioner Marble it was moved and carried that
the following beverage and liquor licenses be granted.

Lorenzi Beverage license $10.00 per quarter year

D.G. Lorenzi Retail liquor license, sealed packages only, $50.00 per quarter year.

Jack Irish	Beverage license $10.00 per quarter year.

Vote was as follows Commissioners Marble, German and Down and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes none.

The selection of special officers to serve at the several election voting precincts in the
City at the coming General City election was next brought before the Board, and upon motion of
Commissioner Down seconded by Commissioner Marble it was moved and carried W.C. German, Police and
Fire Commissioner appoint the Special officer and that the same be sworn in under the official
oath of the City of Las Vegas, by the City Clerk. Compensation for same being $6.00 per day.

Vote was as follows Commissioners Marble, German and Down and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye. Noes none.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting recessed until
Friday the 10th day of May, 1935 at the hour of three o'clock P.M.



OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK, CITY OF LAS VEGAS
CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA
MAY 10th, 1935.

	Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las

Vegas held on the 10th day of May 1935 at the hour of three o'clock P.M.

Roll call showed the following present, Mayor Cragin, Commissioners Arnett, Marble, and
Down, City Attorney Henderson and City Clerk.

Absent Commissioner German.

At this time an amendment to the ordinance creating a Park Commission was taken under con-
sideration, and the various lengths of terms for the commission discussed. The amendment was not
given a first reading at this time.

A number of persons interested in the Clark County Horse Breeders Association appeared before
the Board and stated that the organization had changed the name of the same to the Las Vegas Horse
Breeders Association and that the body was still interested in the installation of a race course
in the said City.

On motion of Commissioner Marble seconded by Commissioner Down it was moved and carried that
three slot machine licenses be granted to Dave Stearns.

Vote was as follows Commissioners Arnett, Marble, and Down and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes none.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting recessed until
Thursday the 16th day of May, 1935 at the hour of three o'clock P.M.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK, CITY OF LAS VEGAS
CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

MAY 16th, 1935.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las
Vegas held on the 16th day of May, 1935 at the hour of three o'clock P.M.

Roll call showed the following present Mayor Pro Tem German, Commissioners Arnett,

Marble and Down, City Attorney and City Clerk.

Absent Mayor Cragin.
On motion of Commissioner Arnett seconded by Commissioner Marble it was moved and carried
that a retail beverage (5½%) be granted to D.G. Lorenzi at the Dance Hall at Lorenzi Lake
Resort. Application being in proper form and money on file with the Clerk to cover the same the
vote was called as follows: Commissioners Arnett, Marble and Down and Mayor pro Tem German voting
aye. Noes none.

At this time the application of the Mission Taxi Company was presented to the Board for con-
sideration. Application being for a taxi license, with proof of policy accompanying the same. After
some discussion on the matter it was on motion of Commissioner Marble seconded by Commissioner
Down moved and carried that the same be granted upon the following vote being called; Commissioners
Marble and Down and Mayor Pro Tem German voting aye. Commissioner Arnett passing his vote.

The Board at this time canvassed the vote cast at the General City Election held on the
7th day of May, 1935, for the election of A Mayor and a Commissioner of the First Class and a
Commissioner of the Second Class and to vote on the proposition of municipally owner power and
light plant, the result of said canvas being as follows:

hereupon, it appearing to the Board that L.L. ARNETT has received a plurality of all votes
cast for the office of Mayor it was there fore RESOLVED on motion of Commissioner Marble, seconded
by Commissioner Down, that the said L.L. Arnett be and he is hereby declared to be the duly
elected Mayor of the City of Las Vegas for the ensuing four years, and it was further RESOLVED
that the City Clerk and she is hereby directed to issue a certificate of election to the said
L.L. Arnett. Voting on the said Resolution Commissioners Arnett, Marble and Down and His Honor
the Mayor Pro Tem voting aye. Noes none.

Thereupon, it appearing to the Board that H.P. MARBLE has received a plurality of all
votes cast for the office of City Commissioner of the First Class it was THEREFORE RESOLVED, on
motion of Commissioner Arnett, seconded by Commissioner Down, that the said H.P. Marble be and
he is hereby declared to be the duly elected City Commissioner of the First Class of the City
of Las Vegas for the ensuing four years, and it was further RESOLVED that the City Clerk be
and she is hereby directed to issue a certificate of election to the said H.P. Marble. Voting
on said Resolution, Commissioners Arnett, Marble, and Down and His Honor the Mayor Pro Tem Aye.
Noes none.
THEREUPON, it appearing to the Board that GENE WARD has received a plurality of all votes
cast for the office of City Commissioner of the Third Class, it was THEREFORE RESOLVED, on
motion of Commissioner Arnett seconded by Commissioner Down, that the said Gene Ward be and
he is hereby declared to be the duly elected City Commissioner of the -Third Class of the City
of Las Vegas for the ensuing term of four years, and it was further Resolved that the City Clerk
be and she is hereby directed to issue a certificate of election to the said Gene Ward. Voting
on s id Resolution, Commissioners Arnett, Marble, and Down and His Honor the Mayor Pro Tem Aye.
Noes none.

Thereupon, it appearing to the Board that Proposition No. 1 on said ballot at said City
lection Held May 7th, 1935 had carried by a large plurality it was on motion of Commissioner
Arnett Seconded By Commissioner Marble that the said Board proceed with said proposition when
in its opinion was the best and most appropriate time to do so.

Vote was as follows Commissioners Arnett, Marble and Down and Mayor Pro Tem German voting
aye. Noes none.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting recessed until Friday
the 24th day of May at the hour of three o'clock P.M.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK, CITY OF LAS VEGAS
CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

MAY 24th, 1935.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las
Vegas held on the 24th day of May at the hour of three o'clock P.M.

Roll call showed the following present, Mayor Cragin, Commissioners Marble and Down, City
Attorney and City Clerk.

Absent Commissioners Arnett and German.

On motion of Commissioner Marble seconded By Commissioner Down it was moved and carried
that the liquor license heretofore issued to the Nevada Wholesale Liquor Corporation at 508 So
Main Street be transferred to 123 South Main Street. Said location being within the zone estab-
lished for wholesale liquor dealers.

Vote was as follows Commissioners Marble and Down and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.

Noes none.

On motion of Commissioner Marble seconded by Commissioner Down it was moved and carried
that two slot machine licenses be granted to the Vegas Sweet shoppe. Application being
proper form and money on file with the Clerk to cover the same.

Vote was as follows: Commissioners Marble and Down and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.

Noes none.

On motion of Commissioner Down seconded by Commissioner Marble it was moved and carried that
a retail beverage license (5½%) be granted to H.P. Muller, 810 Fremont St. Application being
in proper form and money on file with the Clerk to cover the same.

Vote was as follows Commissioners Marble and Down and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.

Noes none.

At this time the resignation of A.R. Thompson as City Engineer, Building and Plumbing
Inspecter for the City of Las Vegas was presented to the Board for consideration.

On motion of Commissioner Down seconded by Commissioner Marble it was moved and carried
that the resignation of A.R. Thompson be accepted as he had accepted a position in Northern
Nevada which would require that his place of residence be changed.

Vote was as follows Commissioners Marble and Down and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.

Noes none.

At this time the application of C.D. Baker for City Engineer for the City of Las Vegas
was presented to the Board for consideration.

On motion of Commissioner Down seconded by Commissioner Marble it was moved and carried
that C.D. Baker be appointed City Engineer and acting Plumbing and Building Inspector for the
City of Las Vegas from May 25th to June 3rd 1935, inclusive. That he would qualify as such
City Engineer by taking the official oath of office Salary to be $150.00 per month.

Vote was as follows Commissioners Marble and Down and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.

Noes none.

As there are a number of improvements anticipated in the City of Las Vegas at this time
with the help of the F.E.R.A. it was on motion of Commissioner Marble seconded by Commissioner
Down moved that the City Clerk be directed to write to Geo. Schmidt, State Comptroller at
Carson City Nevada and ascertain from him all information possible for the securing financial
aid from the F.E.R.A.

Vote was as follows Commissioners Marble and Down and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.

Noes none.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting recessed until
Monday the 3rd day of June, 1935 at the hour of two o'clock
OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK CITY OF LAS VEGAS,
CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

JUNE 3rd, 1935.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas,
held on the 3rd day of June, 1935 at the hour of two o'clock P.M.

The following answered roll call Mayor Cragin Commissioners Arnett, Marble, German and Down
City Attorney Henderson and City Clerk Viola Burns.

All claims allowed as per Claims and Warrant Register on file in the office of the Clerk.

Reports of City Clerk and Municipal Judge approved by Mayor Cragin.

Minutes of all previous meetings read and approved as read.

H.P. Marble, Commissioner-Elect, presented his bond in the sum of One Thousand ($1000.00)
Dollars, with the American Surety Company as surety thereon; said bond having been approved by
Earl Davison, Chairman of the Board of County Commissioners of Clark County Nevada, as required
by law. Mr. Marble also presented his oath of office. Upon motion duly made seconded and carried
said bond and oath of office were duly approved and ordered filed in the office of the City Clerk.

Gene Ward, Commissioner-Elect, presented his bond in he sum of One Thousand ($1000.00)
Dollars, with the American Surety Company as surety thereon; said bond having been approved by
Earl Davison, Chairman of the Board of County Commissioner of Clark County, Nevada, as required
by law. Mr. Ward also presented to the Board his oath of office. Upon motion duly made seconded
and carried said bond and oath of office were approved and ordered filed in the office of the
City Clerk.

Thereupon on motion of Commissioner Ward seconded by Commissioner Marble it was moved and
carried that Commissioner Down act as Chairman of the meeting.

Vote was as follows: Commissioners Arnett, Marble and Ward Down voting aye. Noes, none.

At this time the Clerk presented to the Board the written resignation of L.L. Arnett,

Finance Commissioner of the City of Las Vegas. Mr. Arnett ask that his resignation be given
immediate attention so that he might enter into his duties as the newly elected Mayor of the
City of Las Vegas.

On motion of Commissioner Marble seconded by Commissioner Ward it was moved and carried that
the resignation of L.L. Arnett be accepted.

Vote was as follows, Commissioners Arnett, Marble, and Ward and Chairman Down voting aye.

Noes, none.

L.L. Arnett, Mayor-Elect, of the City of Las Vegas, presented his bond in the sum of One
Thousand ($1000.00) Dollars, with the American Surety Company as surety thereon; said bond having
be approved by Earl Davison, Chairman of the Board of County Commissioner of Clark County, Nevada,
as required by law. Hr. Arnett also presented his oath of office. Upon motion duly made seconded
and carried said bond and oath of office were approved and ordered filed in the office of the
City Clerk.

Thereupon Messers Arnett, Marble and Ward entered upon the duties of their offices.

Mayor Arnett presiding stated that he first order of business to come before the new Board
was the election of one of its members to the office of Mayor Pro Tem.

Upon motion of Commissioner Marble seconded by Commissioner Ward it was moved and carried that
Jas. H. Down, the senior member of the Board be elected Mayor Pro Tem.

Vote was as follows: Commissioner Marble, Ward and Down and Mayor Arnett voting aye. Noes none.

The appointing of a commissioner to fill the unexpired term of L.L. Arnett was next brought
before the Board for consideration. On motion of Commissioner Marble seconded by Commissioner
Down it was moved and seconded by David Farnsworth be appointed to fill the unexpired term of
office caused by the resignation of L.L. Arnett.

Vote was as follows, Commissioners Marble, Ward, and Down and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye. Noes, none.

Thereupon Mayor Arnett appointed the Commissioners to the various departments, as follows:

Jas. H. Down	Commissioner of Water, Sewer and Light.

David Farnsworth Commissioner of Finance

H.P. Marble	Commissioner of Streets and Public Places.

Gene Ward	Commissioner of Police and Fire.

The setting of the day and hour of the regular meeting of the Commission was next brought
before the commission for consideration.

On motion of Commissioner Marble seconded by Commissioner Down it was moved and carried that
the regular meeting of this Board be held on the 4th day of each month, provided if such day fall
upon a Sunday or holiday the meeting will be held on the next secular or business day, without
notice and with out recess or adjournment being required.

Vote was as follows Commissioners Marble Ward, and Down and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

The Clerk presented to the Board communications from Lent D. Upson and Pat McCarran in regard
to the City of Las Vegas securing aid from the Federal Government for the care of the unemployed
On motion of Commissioner Marble seconded by Commissioner Down it was moved and carried that
the communications be placed on file for future reference.

Vote was as follows Commissioners Marble, Ward and Down and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.


The appointing of a permanent City Engineer was next brought before the Board for consideration, and on
motion of Commissioner Down seconded by Commissioner Ward it was moved and carried that C.D. Baker
be appointed to the position of City Engineer. To qualify by taking the official oath of office
and filing with the Clerk a bond in the sum of One Thousand Dollars, to hold office at the pleasure
of the Board of Commissioners.

Vote was as follows Commissioners Marble, Ward and Down and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.

Noes none.

On motion of Commissioner Ward seconded by Commissioner Down it was moved and carried that the
salary of the City Engineer be the sum of One Hundred Fifty Dollars per month, and that he be the acting
Building and Plumbing Inspector of the City of Las Vegas. As such City Engineer he meet the require-
ments as is set forth in Ordinance No. 163 of the City of Las Vegas, and in Section 5½A of the
Charter of the City of Las Vegas.

Vote was as follows Commissioners Marble, Ward and Down and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.

Noes, none.

Mr. Down, Commissioner of Water Sewer and Lights announced that no change was being anticipated
in any of his various departments at this time.

On motion of Commissioner Ward seconded by Commissioner Marble it was moved and carried that
the office of the Chief of Police of the City of Las Vegas be declared vacant as of this date, 3rd of
June, 1935, and that Dave Mackey be appointed Chief of Police to be effective on and after June 16th, '35.

Vote was as follows Commissioner Marble Ward and Down and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.

Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Ward seconded by Commissioner Down it was moved and carried that
O.C. Boggs, Chief of Police of the City of Las Vegas be paid his salary from the 1st to the 15th
of June, 1935,(Inclusive)

Vote was as follows Commissioners Ward and Down and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Commissioner
Marble not voting.

On motion of Commissioner Marble seconded by Commissioner Ward it was moved and carried that
the City Clerk be and she is hereby directed to write Mr. O.C. Boggs and extend to him the apprec-
iation of the Board of City Commissioners for his services rendered the City of Las Vegas.

Vote was as follows Commissioners Marble Ward and Down and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.

Noes none.

Mr. Claude Mackey, of the F.E.R.A. appeared before the Board and ask that that body co-operate
with the F.E.R.A. in the securing of a fish hatchery for this locality.

On motion of Commissioner Marble seconded by Commissioner Down it was moved and carried that
the Board of City Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas co-operate in every way possible with the

F.E.R.A. for the securing of a fish hatchery for this community.

Vote was as follows Commissioners Marble, Ward and Down and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.

Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Marble seconded by Commissioner Ward it was moved and seconded that
the office of Municipal Judge be declared vacant effective June 16th, 1935.

Voting Commissioners Marble, Down and Ward, and His Honor the Mayor aye. Noes none.

On motion of Commissioner Ward seconded by Commissioner Marble it was moved and carried that
T.M. Carroll be appointed Municipal Judge for the City of Las Vegas, Same to be effective as of
June 16th, 1935. Salary to be $100.00 per month, and said T.M. Carroll to qualify by taking the
official oath of office and filing with the City Clerk a bond in the sum of $2,000.00

Vote was as follows Commissioners Ward, and Marble and His Honor the Mayor voting Aye. Com-
missioner Down not voting.

On motion of Commissioner Ward seconded by Commissioner Marble it was moved and carried that
the office of City Attorney be declared vacant as of June 16th, 1935. That A.S. Henderson, present
City Attorney be allowed his entire salary for the month of June, 1935. Salary of new City attorney
to begin as of June 16th, 1935.

Vote was as follows Commissioners Marble Ward and Down and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.

Noes none.

On motion of Mayor Arnett seconded by Commissioner Marble it was moved and carried that Ryland
Taylor be appointed City Attorney, to hold office at the pleasure of the Board of Commissioners,
and to qualify by taking the official oath of office and filing in the Clerk's office a bond in the
sum of One thousand Dollars. Salary for said office being $200.00 per month.

Vote was as follows Commissioner Marble, Ward and Down and His Honor the mayor voting aye.

Noes none.

There upon on motion of Commissioner Marble seconded by Commissioner Ward it was moved and
carried that the City Clerk be directed to write letters of appreciation to both Frank McNamee,
and A.S. Henderson for their faithful services to the City of Las Vegas.

JUNE 4th, 1935.

Minutes of a regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas
held on the 4th day of June 1935 at the hour of five o'clock P.M. (No hour for the holding of
said meetings on the 4th day being set the hour of five o'clock P.M. was designated as the
most logical time to hold this meeting.)

The hour of holding the regular  monthly meeting of the Board of Commissioners was discussed and
it was determined that the hour of seven o'clock P.M. would be the most convenient for all
concerned. Therefore after this date the regular meeting would be held at the hour of seven
o'clock P.M. on the 4th day of each month as set by a resolution passed the 3rd fay of June,
1935.

The following answered roll call Commissioners Marble, Ward and Down, Mayor Arnett,

City Attorney and Clerk.

Mr. Mable was appointed acting Finance Commissioner to approve the few remaining claims
for the month of June.

The Clerk presented to the Board the application of Jake Ensley for a retail beverage
license for 20 Stewart Street. Mr. Ward, Commissioner of Police and Fire ask that said appli-
cation be held up for further investigation.

The application of Jerry George for a taxi license was laid over until the bond or the
proof of bond was presented to the Board.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting recessed until the
6th day of June at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

Clark County, Nevada
June 20, 1935

Minutes of A recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of
Las Vegas, held on the 20th, day of June 1935 at the hour of seven thirty O'clock P. M.

The following answered roll call Mayor Arnett, Commissioners Down, Marble, Farnsworth
and Ward. City Attorney Ryland G. Taylor and Le Roy Whipple Deputy City Clerk. Absent City
Clerk, Viola Burns..

At this time J. A. Williams appeared before the board to ask permission to use water from
the City well for irrigation of his crops for a two weeks period beginning June 21st, Motion
was made by Commissioner Marble and seconded by Commissioner Farnsworth that Mr. Williams be
given permission to use water from the City Well for a period of two weeks beginning June 21st,
and vote was taken as follows; Down, Farnsworth, Marble, Ward and His Honor the Mayor voting
Aye., Noes None..

Mayor Arnett then presented a report issued by the Las Vegas Land and Water Company,
showing the consumption of water used in the City, setting forth that a waste of water existed
throughout the City and asking the Board of City Commissioners cooperation in taking steps to
prohibit such waste of water wherever it was possible to do so. Upon motion made by Commissioner
Marble and seconded by Commissioner Ward, the board went record favoring the following;;;

It appearing to the Board that certain complaints have been made to the effect that there
is unnecessary waster of water within the City of Las Vegas; and it also appearing, after
investigation, that the storage facilities for the city water supply are inadequate to preserve
and utilize for beneficial purposes the natural water supply at its source; that there is, in
fact, an abundance of water to supply this community and even a much larger community than the
City of Las Vegas if it is properly developed, preserved and stored; that the supply might be
preserved by adding to the present or establishing new storage facilities. And the Board being
desirous of preserving, developing and utilizing to the fullest extent the water and other
natural resources of the City for the benefit of its citizens, therefore be it.

"RESOLVED, that the Citizens of Las Vegas be and they hereby are requested to co-operate
with all concerned in the preservation and conservation of the water supply and that they avoid
any waste or unnecessary use of the City's water supply until the problem can be corrected,
or in the absence of such correction by the company, then to give the board an opportunity to
correct the matter." Vote being Down, Farnsworth, Marble, Ward and His Honor the Mayor voting Aye.,
Noes .. None.

Commissioner Marble asked permission of the Board to grant him authority to turn over the
City Park for use on July 12th, to the 145th, Field Artillery - National Guard of Utah for camping
purposes. Upon motion made by Commissioner Down, and seconded by Commissioner Farnsworth, this
was granted, by a vote of the Board and instructions given to the City Clerk's office to write
a letter to Major W. J. Lyons c/o Commissioner Marble, setting forth that Mr. Marble Commissioner
of Streets, had been delegated to act in behalf of the City Commissioners in extending an
invitation to Major W. J. Lyons and the 145th, Field Artillery - National Guard of Utah to use
the City Park for their camping purposed on this date. Vote on same being, Down, Farnsworth,
Marble, Ward and His Honor the Mayor voting Aye., Noes None.

New York for one year beginning June 16th, 1935 to June 16th, 1936 and covering insurance on
Ford V. 8 Coupe used by the Electrical Dept, of the City., was presented to the Board with
