CITY OF LAS VEGAS, VEGAS, NEVADA.

JUNE 24th, 1936

Minutes of a Special Meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas held on
 the 24th ay of June, 1936 at the hour of three o'clock P.M.

The following answered roll call Mayor Arnett, Commissioners Down, Marble and Ward, City
Attorney and City Clerk.

Absent Commissioner Farnsworth.
On motion of Commissioner Marble seconded by Commissioner Ward the following Resolution
was introduced and passed:

RESOLUTION

A resolution authorizing the City of Las Vegas to change the resolution heretofore made
authorizing the application to the United states of America through the Federal Emergency Admin-
istration of Public Works for a loan and grant to aid in financing the construction or pur-
chase and remodeling of a municipal power system and incidental facilities designed as Docket No.
Nevada 1029 to an application for grant only,

Whereas, heretofore and on the ninth day of September, 1935 the City of Las Vegas by resol-
ution authorized certain officers of te City to make application to the Federal Emergency Admin-
istration of Public Works for a loan and grant to aid in financing the construction or purchase
and remodeling of a municipal power system and

Whereas, it is deemed to be for the best interests of the City of Las Vegas that the said
application be changed to an application for a grant only, therefore

BE IT RESOLVED by the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas that the said appli-
cation heretofore made to the Federal Emergency Administration of Public Works for a loan and
grant designated as Docket No. Nevada 1029-R, be and the same hereby is changed to an application
for a grant only, and that L.L. Arnett, Mayor is hereby authorized and directed to do all things
necessary to the end that the said application be changed to a grant only.

Vote on the above Resolution was as follows: Commissioners Down, Marble and Ward and His Honor
the Mayor L.L. Arnett voting aye. Noes, none.

Absent Commissioner Farnsworth.

On motion of Commissioner Down, seconded by Commissioner Marble the following Resolution
was introduced and passed:

RESOLUTION

A resolution authorizing the City of Las Vegas to change the resolution heretofore made auth-
orizing the application to the United States of America through the Federal Emergency Adminis-
tration of Public Works for a loan and grant to aid in financing the construction of street
paving and curbs and gutters in the City of Las Vegas designated as Docket No. Nevada 1021-R to
an application for grant only, and

Whereas, heretofore the City of Las Vegas by resolution authorized certain officers of the
City to make application to the Federal Emergency Administration of Public Works for a loan a d
grant to aid in financing the construction of street paving and curbs and gutters in the City of
Las Vegas, and

Whereas, it is deemed to be for the best interests of the City that the said application be
changed to an application for a grant only, therefore

BE IT RESOLVED by the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas that the said application
 heretofore made to the Federal Emergency Administration of Public Works for a loan and grant
designated as Docket No. Nevada 1021-R, be and the same hereby is changed to an application for
grant only, and that L.L. Arnett, Mayor, is hereby authorized and directed to do all things nec-
essary to the end that the said application be changed to a grant only.

Vote was Commissioners Down, Marble, and Ward and His Honor the Mayor L.L. Arnett, voting
aye. Noes, none. Commissioner Farnsworth, absent.

No further business appearing before the meeting at this time the meeting then adjourned.

It was reported to the Board that the State of Nevada, through its Department of Highways, is
presently engaged in the construction of an underpass on Clark Avenue near Main Street in said City of
Las Vegas, the purpose of which is to eliminate the existing grade crossing and to establish a grade
separation on said Clark Avenue, near Main Street.

Whereas on motion of Commissioner Marble Seconded by Commissioner Down the following Preamble
and Resolution were surely adopted:

AND WHEREAS, Los Angeles & Salt Lake Railroad Company has entered into an agreement, or is
about to enter into an agreement with the said State of Nevada, through its Department of Highways
concerning the construction of said underpass,

AND WHEREAS, it is desirable that the said State of Nevada, through its Department of High-
ways, deal directly with the said Railroad Company in the acquirement of necessary easements and
rights of way for the construction of said underpass, and for the improvement of Clark Avenue,

AND WHEREAS, said Railroad Company has heretofore granted to the City of Las Vegas a certain
grant of Easement for right of way from Main Street to Clark Avenue and along Clark Avenue which
grant of easement is Dated December 18, 1933 and is recorded in Book 21 of Deeds page 113, Clark
County, Nevada, record,

AND WHEREAS, it will benefit the City to reconvey said easement and all of the City's right
title and interest in and to the parcel of land therein described to said Railroad Company
so that said Railroad Company may conveniently enter into said agreement with the State of Nevada,

AND WHEREAS, there has been presented to the Board a form of Reconveyance of said Easement,
which said Reconveyance was read over and considered, and it appearing to the Board that it will
be to the best interests of the	City	and the public that such reconveyance of easement	be	made,

it was therefore on motion duly	made	seconded and carried by the unanimous vote of	the	members

of the Board

RESOLVED that the City of Las Vegas reconvey to Los Angeles end Salt Lake Railroad Company
all its right, title and interest, of, in and to the strip or parcel of land particularly described
in the Deed of Easement dated December 18, 1933, from Los Angeles & Salt Lake Railroad Company
to the City of Las Vegas, which Deed of Easement is recorded in Book 21 of Deed, Page 113, Clark
County, Nevada Records, in accordance with the terms of the form of reconveyance presented to
the Board,

AND BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED that said reconveyance be executed on behalf of the City of Las
Vegas by the Mayor and attested	by the City Clerk under the seal of said City,

AND BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED	that	said reconveyance, when executed be delivered	to the	High-

way Department of the State of Nevada, for delivery to said Railroad Company as and when said Rail-
road Company and the State of Nevada, through its Department of Highways, shall execute an
agreement for the construction of said underpass and the granting of the necessary easement there-
for, and for the improvement of Clark Avenue.

Vote was Commissioners Down, Marble and Farnsworth and His Honor the Mayor voting Aye.

Noes, none. Absent Commissioner Ward.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting recessed and
adjourned until Monday the 29th day of June, at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.
OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK, CITY OF
LAS VEGAS, CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

JUNE 29th, 1936.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las
Vegas held on the 29th day of June, 1936, at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

Roll call showed the following present Mayor Arnett, Commissioners Marble, Farnsworth,
and Ward, City Attorney and Clerk.

Absent Commissioner Ward.

Mr. Claude Mackey, Local Mgr. of the PWA met with the Board at this time in regard to
further improvements at the fish hatchery, and upon motion of Commissioner Marble seconded by
Commissioner Farnsworth it was moved and carried that the Mayor L.L. Arnett write to Mr. Mackey
in substantially the following form.

Las Vegas, Nevada
June 29th, 1936.

Mr. Claude Mackey,

Local Manager PWA
Las Vegas, Nevada.

Dear Mr. Mackey;

This has reference to the conversation with the Board of City Commissioners
yesterday, regarding the local fish hatchery being constructed by the Federal Government under
your supervision, and wherein you expressed apprehension as to the wisdom of pursuing such
construction further.

I have been directed by the Board of Commissioners to advise you that the Board has ex-
pressed the disposition to cooperate with you to the fullest extent possible to the end that at
least three units of this plant be completed.

You expressed the fear that the water supply hereafter to be and now being used to supply
the hatchery might, in the near future, be	diverted	to	the city's use for	municipal purposes.

It is true that this may become necessary,	but	this	is	to	assure you that	such is not the im- 

necessary plan, however, as we all know, the demand may be so great, in view of the limited
supply of water available at this source, that such steps may be necessary in the future. How-
ever, you are assured that the water developed by your department for the use of the fish hatch-
eries will be used as a last resort and only to meet extreme emergency. Other available sources
and supplies of water will of course, be drawn upon first.

We realize that the plant which you are constructing has many advantages.

To avoid probable misunderstanding it might be well for me to state that my conference
with Congressman Scrugham and Commissioner Bell had as its object the procurement for the com-
munity of an additional facility, which we	all	know	to	be	of such extreme	importance to this

area and which is know absolutely necessary to	develop	to	the fullest the	advantages of re-

creational possibilities of Boulder Lake. The local facility would contribute, of course, its
share, but we all know it to be entirely inadequate to fulfill the pressing needs.

Very respectfully,

L.L. Arnett, Mayor.

Vote was Commissioners Farnsworth, Marble and Ward and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none, Absent Commissioner Down.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting then recessed and
adjourned until Tuesday the 30th day of June, 1936 at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK CITY OF LAS VEGAS,
CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

JUNE 30th, 1936.

Minutes of a recessed and adjourned meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of
Las Vegas held on the 30th day of June, 1936, at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

Roll call showed the following present, Mayor Arnett, Commissioners Down, Farnsworth,
Marble and Ward, City Attorney and City Clerk.

Minutes of all regular and recessed regular meetings from January 4th to March 4th,
1936 inclusive read and approved as read.

On motion of Commissioner Down Seconded by Commissioner Farnsworth the following Preamble
and Resolution were introduced and passed:

WHEREAS, this Board, on the fifteenth day of June, 1936, authorized and directed the pur-
chase by the City of the following described property:

Situate in the City of Las Vegas, County of Clark, State of Nevada, described as follows:
Lots Four (4) Five (5), Six (6), Seven (7) and Sight (8) in Block Two (2) and

Lots Three (3), Four (4), Five (5), Six (6), Seven (7) and Eight (8) in Block
Thirty-three (33) of Original Plat of Las Vegas Townsite, as shown by map thereof
on file in the office of the County Recorder of Clark County, Nevada, in Book 1 of
Plats, Page 17, and

WHEREAS, it appears that the clear title cannot be had at this time to Lots 4 and 5 of
Block 2 of Original Plat of Las Vegas Townsite, as shown by map thereof on file in the
office of the County Recorded of Clark County, Nevada, in Book 1 of Plats, Page 17, and it
appearing to be for the best interests of the city that a different arrangement be made for
the purchase of the said property, and

WHEREAS, it appears to the Board that it is necessary to rescind that said Resolution and
order made on the 15th day of June, 1936, with respect to the purchase of said property, there-
fore, be it

RESOLVED: That that said resolution made and entered by the Board on the 15th day of June,
1936, with respect to the purchase of the said above described property be and the same is hereby
rescinded, and be it further

RESOLVED; That the purchase of said Lots 6,7, and 8 in Block 2 and Lots 3,4,5,6,7, and 8
in Block 33 of Original Plat, Las Vegas Townsite, as shown by map thereof in the office of the
County Recorder of Clark County, Nevada, in Book 1 of Plats, Page 17, be made immediately for
Two Thousand Five Hundred ($2,500.00) Dollars cash and that the remainder and residue of the
said property, to-wit: Lots 4 and 5 Block 2 be purchased if and when the Golden West Oil and
Refining Company can furnish a good and clear title and title insurance to the said property
and be it further

Resolved: that the Mayor and City Clerk be, and they hereby are, directed to execute and
deliver to the Pioneer Title Insurance and Trust Company the following letter of instruction.

Pioneer Title Insurance and Trust Company,

Las Vegas, Nevada.

Gentlemen;

With regard to the instructions contained in our letter to you of June 15th, re-
garding the purchase of certain property owned by the Golden West Oil and Refining Company,
a corporation, you are hereby directed to disregard the instructions contained in that
letter and in lieu of those instructions you will be guilded by the following.

When you issue the City of Las Vegas title insurance in the sum of Two Thousand Five Hundred
($2,500.00) Dollars, showing a good and clear title to the City of Las Vegas, free and clear
of all encumbrances, save and except patent reservations, in and to Lots, 6,7,8 in Block 2,
and Lots 3.4.5.6.7. and 8 in Block 33 of Original Plat, Las Vegas Townsite, a shown by may
thereof in the office of the County Recorder of Clark County, Nevada, in Book 1, of Plats
page 17, you will then deliver to Golden West Oil and Refining Company of the money you now hold
for the City the cum of Two Thousand Five Hundred ($2,500.00) Dollars, which is payment in full
for the said lots.

The remaining Five Hundred ($500.00) Dollars you will pay to the said Golden West Oil and Re-
fining Company if and when you can execute to the city title insurance in the sum of Five
Hundred ($500.00) Dollars, showing title in the city free and clear of all encumbrances, save
and except patent reservations, in and to Lots 4 and 5, Block 8 of the Original Plat of Las
Vegas Townsite, as shown by map thereof in the office of the County Recorder of Clark County,
Nevada, in Book 1 of Plats, Page 17.

The golden West Oil and Refining Company, a corporation, agrees that it will immediately take
all steps necessary to furnish the city with a clear title and title insurance to Lots 4 and 5,
Block 2, of the Original Plat of Las Vegas Townsite, as shown by may thereof in the office of
the County Recorder of Clark County, Nevada, in Book 1, Plats, page 17. And it further agrees
that the said title will be furnished the city within a reasonable time, and that the expenses
of the said title and escrow will be borne by the Golden West Oil and Refining Company.

Provided, however, should you be unable within the months from the date hereof to furnish
us title insurance to Lots Four (4) and Five (5) in Block Two (2) aforesaid, as herein
provided, then and in such event, on demand of the City, you will return the said Five Hundred
Dollars ($500.00), so being held by you, to the City of Las Vegas.

It is understood and agreed that time is of the essence of this agreement.

Dated this 30th day of June, 1936.

BY AUTHORITY OF THE BOARD OF CITY COMMISSIONERS

Mayor.

Attest:

City Clerk

The foregoing instructions and understandings are assented to this 30th day of June, 1936.

GOLDEN WEST OIL AND REFINING COM ANY

BY________________________Its	President

BY________________________Its	Secretary.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK CITY OF LAS VEGAS
CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

JULY 24th, 1936.

Minutes of a recessed	and adjourned meeting of the	Board of Commissioners	of	the	City	of

Las Vegas held on the	24th	day of July, 1936 at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

Roll call showed the following present Mayor Arnett Commissioners Down, Farnsworth and
Ward, City Attorney and City Clerk.

Absent Commissioner Marble.

The Board entered into a discussion on the securing of a right of way on Clark Ave;
Westside the following Order was issued by the Board of City Commissioners:

It appearing to the Board that the State Highly Department in contemplating the con-
struction of an underpass under the Union Pacific Railroad on Clark Avenue in the City of Las
Vegas, and that there	appears to be some question as to	the title of certain land	necessary

for use as a right of	way,	which said land is described	as follows:

A Parcel or strip of land of varying width, which lies and is within a portion of Block

One of the original townsite of Las Vegas, situate in the NE¼ of the SW¼ of Section 27,

T.20 S., R. 61 3., M.D.B. & M., being more fully described by metes and bounds, as

follows, to-wit:
Beginning at the southeast corner of said NE¼ of the SW¼ of Section 27, T. 20S., R. 61 E.,
MD.B.& M., said corner described as being 1/16 corner sent in concrete and established
by the City of Las Vegas, and bearing north a distance of 29.59 feet from Engineer's
Station "L" 0-79.71 P.O.C., thence S.88 17' W. along the southernly boundary of said
NE¼ a distance of 280.86 feet to a point on the northerly right of way line of the present
Highway, then N. 62 06' W. along said right of way line a distance of 55.10 feet to a
point on the railroad right of way line, thence N. 27 54'30" E. along said railroad right
of way line a distance of 26.20 feet to a point on the proposed northerly 40 foot highway
right of way line, thence N. 88 17' E. along said right of way line a distance of 119.83
feet to a point, thence from a tangent whose bearing is the last described course curving
to the right along said right of way line with a radius of 540 feet through an angle of
21 19' 30" a distance of 200.98 feet to a point on the easterly boundary of said NE¼,
thence south along said easterly boundary a distance of 11.50 feet to the point of beginning.

And the City having heretofore expressed to said State Highway Department its disposition
to furnish said State Highway Department with a good and sufficient right of way, and the City
being desirous of cooperating with said State Highway Department to the fullest, and still
being desirous of cooperating with the State Highway Department to the extent of furnishing the
said State Highway Department with a good and sufficient right of way for such purposes,
it is therefore

ORDERED that the City commit itself at this time to do all, each and every thing now nec-
essary, or which may hereafter be necessary to secure, preserve and defend the title of the
said State Highway Department in and to the above described premises and right of way, and the
City further hereby commits itself to prosecute condemnation proceedings if necessary to secure
title to the above described property and also any and every other proceeding that may become
necessary to the end of obtaining or securing title to the said right of way for the benefit
of the State Highway Department.

The foregoing Order was introduced by Commissioner Down and seconded by Commissioner
Farnsworth, and the vote upon the adoption of the same was Commissioners Down, Farnsworth,

Ward and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none. Commissioner Marble, absent.

The matter of securing a "shoofly" for the City of Las Vegas was next considered and
after due consideration the following Preamble and Resolution was introduced and passed:

WHEREAS, the State Highway Department is contemplating the construction of an under
pass under the Union Pacific Railroad System on Clark Avenue in the City of Las Vegas; and

WHEREAS, it is necessary and convenient for said State Highway Department to use certain
of the City land adjacent to the said Union Pacific System to construct a shoofly incidental
to the construction of the said underpass, and have requested the use of the said land from
the City, be it, therefore,

RESOLVED, that in order to facilitate the construction of the said underpass and in co-
operation with the State Highway Department that the City enter into an agreement with the
State Highway Department granting the said State Highway Department a temporary easement upon
the said land, a copy of which contract, without signatures, is hereunto annexed and

The Mayor and City Clerk are hereby authorized, empowered and directed to execute, on be-
half of the City, the said hereunto annexed contract.

The foregoing Preambles and Resolution were introduced by Commissioner Down and seconded
by Commissioner Farnsworth.

The vote was Commissioners Down, Farnsworth and Ward and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none. Commissioner Marble absent.

On motion of Commissioner Down seconded by Commissioner Ward it was moved and carried that
D.G. Lorenzi and Ray Mann be issued retail beverage licenses for the third quarter year and
that Ray Murphy be issued three slot machine licenses for the same period of time. All appli-
cations being in proper form and money on file with the clerk to cover the same.

Vote was Commissioner Down, Farnsworth and Ward and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes,

none.

All minutes of regular recessed regular and special meeting of the Board held from May
20 to June 8th, 1936 read and approved as read.

An application from the First State Bank of the City of Las Vegas for permission to place
a fuel Oil storage tank under the side walk on the Westside of said bank building was presented
to the Board for consideration.

On motion of Commissioner Farnsworth seconded by Commissioner Down the following Permit
was issued:

BE IT RESOLVED that a Permit is hereby issued to the First State Bank of the City of Las
Vegas for permission for installation of a fuel oil tank under the side walk approximately
ninety (90) feet from the northeast corner of First and Fremont Street on North First Street,
and

BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED that this permit is granted suggest to the approval of C.D. Baker
City Engineer and H. Case Chief of the Las Vegas Fire Department, provided it does not violate
any codes or laws of the City of Las Vegas.

Vote was Commissioners Down, Farnsworth, and Ward and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.

Noes, none.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting recessed and
adjourned until Tuesday the 28th day of July at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK CITY OF
LAS VEGAS, CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

Minutes of a special meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas
held on the 27th day of July, 1936, at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

Roll call showed the following present, Mayor Arnett, Commissioners Down, Farnsworth
and Ward, City Attorney and City Clerk.

Absent Commissioner Marble.

This meeting being called for the purpose of discussing and entering into an agreement
with the Western Air Express Corp. for the operation of the City's Municipal Airport if
satisfactory terms could be decided upon the Board at once entered into a detailed examin-
ation of a proposed agreement.

Leo Dwerlkotte Sec'y. Treasurer of the Western Air Express Corp. and his attorney Leo
McNamee representing the said company appeared before the Board.

No definite action was to the entering into the agreement or lease was reached at this
time, but Mr. Dwerlkotte was to present to the Board of Directors of the Western Air Express
Corp. for their consideration the various proposed changes in the agreement and report to the
Board of City Commissioners sometime in the near further.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting adjourned.

Minutes of a special meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas held
on the 28th day of July, 1936 at the hour of 10 o'clock A.M.

Roll call showed the following present Mayor Arnett, Commissioners Down and Ward and City
Attorney and Clerk.

Absent Commissioners Farnsworth and Marble.

Mr. Dwerlkotte and Mr. Mc Namee representing the Western Air Express Corporation appeared
before the Board in regard to escrow agreements for the leasing of the City's Municipal Airport.

The meeting convened from 10 to 12 o'clock A.M. and reconvened from 1:30 to 3:30 P.M. and
no decision being reach the meeting adjourned with Mr. Dwerlkotte returning to Los Angeles to
appear before the Board of Directors of the Western Air Express Corp. to inform them that the
City would not agree to the last clause in the escrow agreement, the time or life of the escrow.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK CITY OF LAS VEGAS,

CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA,

AUGUST 4th, 1936.

Minutes of a regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas, Clark
county Nevada, held on the 4th day of August, 1936 at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

Roll call showed the following present, Mayor Arnett, Commissioners Down, Farnsworth,

Marble and Ward, City Attorney and City Clerk.

All claims allowed as per "Claims and Warrant Register" on file in the office of the Clerk.

Report of City Clerk approved by the Mayor.

Mr. August Berning of the State Highway Department appeared before the Board in regard to
the rescinding of a Resolution previously passed in regard to a shoofly over the proposed under-
pass crossing on Clark Avenue, and of the enacting of a Resolution taking the place of the
rescinded Resolution.

After some discussion on the matter the following Preambles and Resolution were adopted:

WHEREAS, the State Highway Department of the State of Nevada is contemplating the constru-
ction of an underpass under the Union Pacific Railroad System on Clark Avenue in the City of
Las Vegas; and

WHEREAS, it is necessary and convenient for the said State Highway Department to use cer-
tain of the City land adjacent to the said Union Pacific System to construct a shoofly incidental
to the construction of the said underpass, and have requested the use of the said land from the
City; and

WHEREAS, on the 15th day of July, 1936, to the end of facilitating the construction of
the said shoofly , a resolution was adopted directing the mayor and the city clerk to enter
into an agreement with the State Highway Department granting the said department an easement
over certain lands, and

WHEREAS, it appears that certain conditions in the said contract are impossible of per-
formance by the said State Highway Department and the said State Highway Department having
requested a substitute agreement in that behalf, and the city being desirous of entering into
the said substitute agreement, be it therefore

RESOLVED: That the said resolution heretofore entered into on the 15th day of July, 1936,
upon the before mentioned subject, together with the contract entered into under the authority
of the said resolution, be and the same hereby are revoked and rescinded, and be it further
ordered that in order to facilitate the construction of the said underpass and in cooperation
with the State Highway Department that the City enter into an agreement with the State Highway
Department granting the said State Highway Department a temporary easement upon the said land,
a copy of which contract, is hereunto annexed, and

That Mayor and City Clerk are hereby authorized empowered and directed to execute, on behalf
of the City the said hereunto annexed contract.

Dated this fourth day of August, 1936.

The foregoing Resolution was introduced by Commissioner Marble and seconded by Commissioner

Down.

Vote was Commissioners Down, Farnsworth, Marble and Ward, and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye. Noes, none. Absent, none.

All unread minutes or regular, recessed regular and special meetings read and approved as

read.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting recessed and adjourned
 until Friday the 7th day of August, 1936, at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK, CITY OF LAS VEGAS

AUGUST 14th, 1936.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las
-egas held on Friday the 14th day of August, 1936 at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

Roll call showed the following present Mayor Arnett, Commissioners Down, Farnsworth
Marble and Ward, City Attorney and City Clerk.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners held on Friday
the 7th day	of August, 1936 at the hour seven o'clock P.M.	read and	approved as read.

The matter of the paying of a	claim of $6,744.74	to	the State Highway Department	of

of the State of Nevada was considered and the letter of recommendation of the City Attorney
was read to the Board. The City Attorney stated in his letter that he did not believe that said
claim was a claim that could legally be paid by the City.

Thereupon on motion of Commissioner Marble seconded by Commissioner Farnsworth it was
moved and carried that the Clerk be directed the State Highway Department and report the
findings of	the	City Attorney and a	copy of his letter	the	Mayor.

Vote	was	Commissioners Down,	Farnsworth, Marble	and	Ward and	His Honor the Mayor	voting

aye. Noes, none.

Dr. W.R.Smith appeared before the Board in regard to a fixed salary of the Meat Inspect-
or for the City of Las Vegas. He was requested to work with the Meat Inspection and Milk In-
spection Boards and ascertain of some plan might be worked out which would be effective.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting recessed and
adjourned until Friday the 21st, day of August, 1936 at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK, CITY OF
LAS VEGAS, CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.
AUGUST 21st, 1936.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las
Vegas held Friday the 21st day of August, 1936 at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

Roll call showed the following present Mayor Arnett, Commissioners Down, Farnsworth and
Ward, City Attorney and Clerk.

Absent Commissioner Marble.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las
Vegas held August 21st, 1936 read and approved as read.

On motion of Commissioner Down seconded by Commissioner Ward it was moved and carried
that Geo. Earlywine be granted a retail beverage license for 113 No. 5th St. and that Jack
Weisberger be granted one 5¢ slot machine license for the same address. All application being
in proper form and money on file with the clerk to cover the same.

Vote was Commissioners Down, Farnsworth and Ward and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.
The renewal of the lease had with the Los Angeles and Salt Lake R.R. for lease of ground
to be used as a City Stockade came before the Board for consideration at this time, and the
following Preamble and Resolution was introduce and passed:

That certain lease agreement, entered into between the Los Angeles and Salt Lake Railroad
Company, a corporation, and the City of Las Vegas Nevada, a municipal corporation, in the County
of Clark, State of Nevada, on the first day of October, 1931, covering the lease of premises in
in Las Vegas, Clark County, Nevada to be used for a prison detention yard, said lease being
Railroad Company's Audit No. 8448, will expire September, 30, 1936, and it appearing that it
will be fore the best interest of said City that said lease agreement be renewed for a further
period of five years from the expiration thereof; It Is Therefore

RESOLVED, by the unanimous vote of all members present that said Lease Agreement be renewed
for a further period of five years, from September 30, 1936 and that the Mayor of the City of
Las Vegas, and the City Clerk, be and they are hereby authorized and directed to execute on behalf
of the City of Las Vegas, Nevada, an Agreement extending the term of said lease agreement for a
further period of five years, from September 30, 1936 and to deliver the same to said Railroad
company as the act and deed of the City.

The above resolution was introduced by Commissioner Down and Seconded by Commissioner Farns-
worth and vote on the same was Commissioners Down, Farnsworth and Ward and His Honor the Mayor
voting aye. Noes, none.

The next matter of business to be brought before the Board was the adopting of an amended
Budget for the City of Las Vegas for the year 1936, and upon motion of Commissioner Farnsworth
seconded by Commissioner Down a budget for the year 1936 was adopted in substantially the follow-
ing form:

CITY BUDGETS

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK, CITY OF
LAS VEGAS, CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA
AUGUST 28, 1936

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las
Vegas held Friday August 28th, 1936 at the hour of seven o'clock P. M.

Roll call showed the following present Commissioners Down, Farnsworth and Ward - City
Attorney Ryland G. Taylor and Deputy City Clerk Le Hoy Whipple

Absent Mayor L. L. Arnett and Commissioner H. P. Marble:

Commissioner Jas H. Down acted as Mayor Pro Tem and presided over the meeting in the
absence of the Mayor.

A request for a transfer of the gaming license covering 'A Race Horse Book' issued to
The Northern Club during the third calendar quarter, from 17 Fremont Street to 15 Fremont St,
was asked for by the licensee, after some discussion it was decided to hold up such grant until
the City Attorney could make further investigations concerning such a transfer.

At this time a report from City Health Physician Dr. F. R. Mildren was read before the
commission. The report covering conditions in and around the Las Vegas Packing Co, advised
that parts of the plant was still in a bad condition and needed cleaning up. The report was
ordered filed.
There being no further business appearing before the board at this time, the meeting re-
cessed and adjourned until the regular meeting of the board on September 4th, 1936 at the hour
of seven o'clock P. M.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK CITY OF
LAS VEGAS, CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

SEPTEMBER 4th, 1936.

Minutes of a regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas held on
the 4th day of September, 1936 at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

Roll call showed the following present Mayor Arnett, Commissioners Down, Farnsworth, Marble
and Ward, City Attorney and City Clerk.

All claims allowed as per "Claims and Warrant Register," on file in the office of the Clerk.

Report of City Clerk approved by the Mayor.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting held August 21st, read and approved as read.

The transferring of a license issued to the Norther Club at 17 Fremont for the operation of
a "race Horse Book" was brought before the Board for consideration, and on motion of Commissioner
Marble seconded by Commissioner Farnsworth it was moved and carried that the license heretofore
issued to the Northern Club for the operation of a "race horse book" at 17 Fremont Street be
transferred to 15 Fremont Street same to be as before under the operation of the Norther Club.

Vote was Commissioners Down, Farnsworth, and Marble and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes,
none. Commissioner Ward being excused before the motion was introduced.

R.J. Fyhen, Vice president of the Nevada Federation of Labor appeared before the Board in
regard to the repealing of the picketing ordinance effective in the City of Las Vegas.

The Clerk read to the Board a letter received from the State Federation of Labor asking that
said ordinance be repealed, and upon motion of Commissioner Marble seconded by Commissioner Down
it was moved and carried that the letter be referred to the City Attorney for investigation and
for report on the same to be had at an early date.

Vote was Commissioners Down, Farnsworth and Marble and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.

Noes, none.

At this time the Board took under consideration the purchasing from the Las Vegas Horseman's
Association materials used at the City race track. After some discussion on the matter on motion
of Commissioner Down seconded by Commissioner Farnsworth it was moved and carried That Commission-
er Marble negotiate with the Horseman's Ass'n. for the purchase of the above mention materials and
report his findings to the Board at the next recessed meeting.

Vote was Commissioners Down, Farnsworth and Marble and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes,

none.

The business of a member of the Board of Commissioners attending a convention of the Four
States Highway meeting in Whitefish, Montana the 10th day of September, 1936 was next considered.

On motion of Commissioner Marble seconded by Commissioner Farnsworth it was moved and car-
ried that Mayor Arnett represent the City at the convention and if he was unable to attend that
he appoint a member of the Commission to act in his stead. Expense of said trip to be paid by the
City.

Vote was Commissioners Down, Farnsworth and Marble and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes,

none

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting recessed and adjourned
until Wednesday the 10th day of September, 1936 at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK, CITY OF LAS VEGAS
CLARK COUNTY NEVADA.

SEPTEMBER 9th, 1936.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas
held on the 9th day of September, 1936, at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

Roll call showed the following present Mayor Arnett, Commissioners Down, Farnsworth, Marble
and Ward, Depty City Attorney Ham and City Clerk.

Absent City Attorney Taylor.

Minutes of a recessed meeting of the Board of Commissioners held on the 28th day of August,
1936 read and approved as read.
E.C.Waterman, of Oakland California appeared before the Board in regard to the leasing of the
ground purchased by the City to be used as a municipal airport. Mr. Waterman stated to the Board
that he would present in writing to the Board for its consideration his plans for the operation of
an airport. He stated that the port would be open for use by any air craft that might desire the
use of the field, and that student training field would be maintained there.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting recessed and ad-
journed until Wednesday the 16th day of September, at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK,

CITY OF LAS VEGAS, CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA
SEPTEMBER 16th, 1936.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las
Vegas held on the 16th day of September, 1936 at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

Roll call showed the following present Mayor Pro Tem Down, Commissioners Marble and Ward,
and City Clerk Viola Burns.

Absent Mayor Arnett, Commissioner Farnsworth and City Attorney Taylor.

On motion of Commissioner Marble seconded by Commissioner Ward it was moved and carried
that the letter received from The "Eureka Fire Hose Co." be referred to the Fire Chief Case for
explanation and recommendation.

Vote was Commissioners Marble and Ward and Mayor Pro Tem Down voting aye. Noes, none.

Mr. Waterman appeared before the Board and presented for its consideration his proposal
for the leasing of the airport. No action was taken but Mr. Waterman was assured that the
Board would consider his proposal at such a time when all members of said Board were present.

On motion of Commissioner Marble seconded by Commissioner Ward it was moved and carried that
a letter from the Associated Oil Company asking permission for the use of a small portion of
South Main Street for the erection of gas pumps be referred to C.D.Baker for investigation, and
report at the next meeting of the Board of Commissioners.

Vote was Commissioners Marble and Ward and Mayor Pro Tem Down voting aye. Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Marble seconded by Commissioner Ward it was moved and carried that
M.L. Dougan be given permission to move into the City of Las Vegas a small house to be situated
on a lot on the NW corner of 9th & Bridger Streets, amd that C.D.Baker City Building Inspector
grant the necessary permits and make the necessary inspections.

Vote was Commissioners Marble and Ward, and Mayor Pro Tem Down voting aye. Noes, none.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting recessed and ad-
journed until Monday the 28th day of September at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK, CITY OF
LAS VEGAS, CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

SEPTEMBER 28th, 1936.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las
Vegas held on the 28th day of September, 1936 at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

Roll call showed the following present Mayor Pro Tem Down, Commissioners Farnsworth, Marble
and Ward, City Attorney and City Clerk.

Mayor Arnett, absent.

The Board at this time discussed the business of enforcing Section 23 of Ordinance No. 36
whereby all persons having property abutting on a sewer main or lateral must connect on to said
sewer.

The Clerk was directed to have some publicity give this matter before The Board of Com-
missioners should issue an order forcing said property owner to connect to sewers.

The City Attorney brought to the attention of the Board the fact that the Assay Office
located at the corner of 6th & Clark Streets in the City of Las Vegas, and the herd of cattle
of the Oppedyk Dairy on North Main Street were proving very unsanitary and numerous complaints
had been received in regard to both locations.

Mr. Taylor City Attorney was directed to write the operator of the Assay office and in-
form him that no license for the operation of same would be issued in the future. That said
office must be located in the commercial district.
Mr. Bell and Mr. Fellows appeared before the Board in regard to chicken yards in their
residential district as being unsightly, and unsanitary and creating bad odors and ask that
steps be taken to have same removed or cleaned up.

On motion of Commissioner Ward seconded by Commissioner Farnsworth it was moved and carried
that the Clerk write Dr. Mildren City Health officer and ask that he investigate the reports of the
Oppedyk Dairy and the poultry yards and report his findings to the Board of Commissioners.

Vote was Commissioners Farnsworth, Marble and Ward, and Mayor Pro Tem Down, voting aye.

Noes, none.

Mr. Underhill and Mr. Edwards appeared before the Board with the report of the sale of soda
water at the ball games held through the summer months, and presented the Board with a check of
$32.50 as the City's share in the sale of said soda water.

ON motion of Commissioner Marble seconded By Commissioner Farnsworth it was moved and carried
that the report and the check be accepted.

Vote was Commissioners Farnsworth, and Marble and Mayor Pro Tem Down, voting aye. Commissioner
Ward voting no.

On motion of Commissioner Marble seconded by Commissioner Ward it was moved and carried thar
Paul Warner be granted a retail tavern liquor license for 124 1st St. for the fourth quarter
year.

Vote was Commissioners Farnsworth, Marble and Ward, and Mayor Pro Tem Down voting aye. Noes,

none

On motion of Commissioner Ward seconded by Commissioner Farnsworth it was moved and car-
ried that a retail sealed package liquor license be granted to Jake Ensley at 220 No. 1st St.
for the fourth quarter year.

Vote was Commissioners Farnsworth, Marble and Ward, and Mayor Pro Tem Down voting aye. Noes,

none.

On motion of Commissioner Marble seconded by Commissioner Farnsworth the following gaming
licenses for the fourth quarter year were granted. All applications being in proper form and money
on file with the clerk to cover the same.

Boulder Club Inc. 118 Fremont St.

Las Vegas Club 23 Fremont St.

	Apache Casino	126 Fremont St.

Sal Sagev Tavern Inc. 1 Fremont St. 4 slot Machine licenses.

Vote was Commissioner Farnsworth, Marble and Ward, and Mayor Pro Tem Down voting aye. Noes,

none.

Two bids received for fire hose were filed with the Clerk for recommendation and report
of Fire Chief Case.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting adjourned.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK, CITY OF
LAS VEGAS, CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

OCTOBER 5th, 1936.

Minutes of a regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas held
on the 5th day of October, 1936 at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

Roll call showed the following present, Mayor Arnett, Commissioners Down, and Marble, Deputy
City Attorney Ham and City Clerk.

Absent Commissioners Farnsworth and Ward and City Attorney Taylor.

All claims allowed as per claims and warrant register on file in the office of the Clerk.

Venis Lancaster appeared before the Board in regard to securing a "tavern liquor license"
for the Bank Tavern at 109 No. 1st St. The application being on file with the the Clerk and the
sum of $250.00 accompanying said application.

After some discussion on the matter on motion of Commissioner Marble seconded by Commis-
sioner Down it was moved and carried that the license be granted.

Vote was Commissioners Down, Farnsworth, Marble and Ward, and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye. Noes, none. Commissioners Farnsworth and Ward arriving before the vote was called.

A letter from David Mackey, Chief of the Las Vegas Police Dept. asking that the retail
beverage license heretofore granted to Leonora Aguirre for 126 So. 1st Street be revoked on the
grounds that the operation of said business was creating a nuisance was read to the Board.

On motion of Commissioner Down, seconded by Commissioner Marble it was moved and carried
that said license be revoked as same had been requested by the Chief of Police.

Vote was Commissioner Down, Farnsworth, Marble and Ward, and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye. Noes, none.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting recessed and
adjourned until Tuesday the 6th day of October at the hour of two o'clock P.M.

Roll call showed the following present, Mayor Arnett, Commissioners Down, Marble and Ward, Deputy

Absent Commissioner Farnsworth, and City Attorney Taylor.

the Travelers Auto Court, a corporation, be granted permission to erect a sign at the corner of

Earl Noon be granted a retail tavern liquor license for 219 No. 1st Street and Pilar Santa Cruz

form and money on file with the Clerk to cover the same.

Vote was Commissioners Down, Marble and Ward and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

Nr. Kelley of the Nevada Meat and Provision Company appeared before the Board in regard to the
fees for slaughtering animals at the company's plant. Mr. Kelley was given until Monday the 12th
day of October to prepare and present same to the Board for its consideration.

On Motion of Commissioner Ward seconded by Commissioner Down it was moved and carried that
Frank Kernan be granted a retail sealed package liquor license for 303 No. Main Street.

Vote was Commissioners Down, Marble and Ward and Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, None.

a wholesale liquor license be granted to the Acme Distributing Company. Application being in proper
form and money to cover same on file with the Clark. (The Acme Distributing Company had held a

The Clerk at this time read to the Board a letter from W.B. Mundy, Ex-officio City Treasurer
and F.C.DeVinney, Ex-officio City Assessor asking that their respective salaries be increased the

the salaries of the said Treasurer and Assessor be increased the	sum	of $25.00 per	month. Same	to

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK CITY OF
LAS VEGAS, CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

OCTOBER 13th, 1936.

Minutes of a recessed and adjourned meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of
Las Vegas held on the 13th day of October, 1936, at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

Roll call showed the following present, Mayor Arnett, Commissioners Down, Marble and
Farnsworth and Ward, City Clerk and Attorney.

Harold Case Chief of the Las Vegas Fire Department appeared before the Board in regard to
the securing of 1000 feet of hose for the Fire Department.	

After some discussion on the matter on motion of Commissioner Marble, seconded by Commis-
sioner Farnsworth it was moved and carried that the City of Las Vegas purchase 1000 feet of
fire hose from the Eureka Fire Hose Company as same was the quality that the Fire Department
had been using having proved most satisfactory and being highly recommend by the Fire Chief.

Same to paid cash on delivery.

Vote was Commissioner Down, Farnsworth, Marble end Ward and His Honor the Mayor voting Aye.
Noes, none.
Reports of Municipal Judge and City Clerk approved by the Mayor.

A letter from the Building Trades Council was read to the Board. This letter and a Resol-
ution requested the Board of Commissioners to take immediate action against the moving of houses
from Boulder City into the City of Las Vegas.

On motion of Commissioner Marble seconded by Commissioner Down it was moved and carried that
the letter and Resolution be handed to the City Attorney and City Engineer for investigation and
report.

Vote was Commissioners Down, Farnsworth, Marble and Ward and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Down seconded by Commissioner Marble it was moved and carried that
the City Engineer be instructed to issued permits for the moving in and locating of five houses
from Boulder City. The said five houses to be owned and improved by the following owners:

Glenn Purdy, W.C.Whitehead, Lola G. Allen,

Vote was Commissioners Down, Marble, Farnsworth and Ward, and His Honor the Mayor voting
aye. Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Marble seconded by Commissioner Farnsworth it was moved and carried
that John Cotter and P. Huston be granted retail beverage licenses for the fourth quarter year.

Vote was Commissioners Down, Farnsworth, Marble and Ward and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

Op motion of Commissioner Down seconded by Commissioner Ward that all slot machine license
applications on file with the Clerk be granted at this time.

OFFICE OF THE CITY CLERK, CITY OF
LAS VEGAS CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.

NOVEMBER 4th, 1936

Minutes of a regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas held
on the 4th day of November, 1936 at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

Roll call showed the following present Mayor Arnett, Commissioners Don, Farnsworth, Mar-
ble and Ward, City Clerk and City Attorney.

All claims allowed as per claims and warrant register on file in the office of the Clerk.
Report of City Clerk approved by the Mayor.

The Board at this time entered into a discussion of the offer of the United States of
America to aid by way of grant in financing the construction of street improvements, and the
following resolution to be known as Resolution I, of the Board of Commissioners of the City
of Las Vegas was proposed by Commissioner Marble:

RESOLUTION I____

BE IT RESOLVED BY THE BOARD OF CITY COMMISSIONERS OF THE CITY OF LAS VEGAS:

Section 1. hat the offer of the United States of America to the City of Lag Vegas to
aid by way of grant in financing the construction of street improvements, a copy of which
offer reads as follows:

P.W. 59321-152

FEDERAL EMERGENCY ADMINISTRATION
OF PUBLIC WORKS

Washington, D.C.

Dated Oct. 23, 1936

	Docket No. Nev. 1021-D

City of Las Vegas,

Clark County, Nevada.

Las Vegas, Nevada.

Subject to the Terms and Conditions (PWA Form No. 210, July 1, 1936) which
are made a part hereof, the United States of America hereby offers to aid in the financ-
ing the construction of street improvements (herein called the "Project") by making a
grant to the City of Las Vegas in the amount of 45 percent of the cost of the Project
upon completion, as determined by Federal Emergency Administrator of Public Works, but
not to exceed in any event, the sum of $34.364.
UNITED STATES OF AMERICA
Federal Emergency Administrator of
Public Works

By (sgd) E.W. Clark_______________________

For the Assistant Administrator

be and the same is hereby in all respects accepted.

Section 2. That this acceptance of the said offer by the United States of America to the City
of Las Vegas shall be effective when a copy of this resolution, duly certified by the City
Clerk, shall have been received by the Federal Emergency Administrator of Public Works.

Section 3. That this Board of City Commissioners agrees to abide by all the Terms and con-
ditions ( PWA From No. 210, July, 1936) relating to such grant, a copy of which terms and
conditions was annexed to the Government's offer to the City of Las Vegas and made a part
thereof.

Section 4. That it is hereby covenanted that the work on the project described in the offer
will be commenced as early as possible but in no event later than January 11, 1937; that the
work will be planned so that it will reach a substantial peak before April, 11, 1937; and that
the project will be completed by January 11, 1938.

Section 5. That the City Clerk be and she is hereby authorized and directed forthwith to
send to the Federal Emergency Administration of Public Works three certified copies of this Res-
olution and three certified copies of the proceedings of this Board of City Commissioners
in connection with the adoption of this resolution, and such and further documents or proofs
in connection with the acceptance of said offer as may be requested by the Federal Emergency
Administration of Public Works.

The above resolution was seconded by Commissioner Down and adopted, with the following named
Commissioners voting "Aye"; L.L. Arnett, James. H. Down, David Farnsworth, H.P. Marble and
Ward; and the following named Commissioners voting "Nay": none.

The Mayor thereupon declared said resolution carried and the Mayor and the City Clerk there-
upon signed said resolution an approval thereof.

Mr. Peters and Mr. Mackey appeared before the Board in regard to the installation of the heating
system in the War Memorial Building. They were informed that they would receive the cooperat-
ion of the Board in this matter.

of the work and of the locality to be improved.

Roll call showed the following present Mayor Arnett, Commissioners Down and Marble,

At this time Mr. H. Krause and Mr. H.L. Perry the newly appointed Commissioners of the
City appeared before the Board and qualified by taking the official oath of office. Same being

The proceeding of improving a tract of ground owned by the City adjoining the Fish Hatchery
under the W.P. A. was considered. Said tract of ground to be improved with a nine hole golf
course.

After some discussion on the matter on motion of Commissioner Marble seconded by Commis-
sioner Down it was moved and carried that the City through its Mayor and Clerk sign the nec-
essary papers and forward same to Claude Mackey, F.E.R.A. Director of this district, and to
do each and every act toward the improving of the ground owned by the City adjoining the
Fish Hatchery with a nine hole golf course.

Vote was Commissioners Down, Krause, Marble and Perry His Honor the Mayor voting aye.

Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Marble seconded by Commissioner Krause the following Resol-
ution was introduced and passed:

RESOLVED; Whereas, the City of Las Vegas, Nevada has accepted the offer of the Federal
Emergency Administration of Public Works for a grant of $34,364.00 to aid in financing the con-
struction of concrete curb and gutters and oil bound gravel on certain streets in said City,
under PWA Docket No. 1021-R- Nevada, and desires to perform said work on a force account basis,

NOW, BE IT RESOLVED, by the Board of City Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas, Nevada,
that the Federal Emergency Administration of Public Works, through his State Director for Nev-
ada, be requested to approve this construction by force account, for the following reasons:

(1)	The City has the equipment and the supervisory personnel to accomplish said con-
struction more economically by force account than by contract;

(2)	The type of work does not require the use of any other equipment or personnel not now.
available to the City, and there are no local contractors engaged in contracting this
type of work who would be deprived of an opportunity to bid;

(3)	Past experience of the City with outside contractors has resulted in increased cost
and inferior construction, and has led to the City's undertaking its own construction
work and representing to the taxpayers who will be included in the assessment district
that this work will be done by force account.

(4)	The estimates of the cost of construction are based upon past experience of the cost

of similar work, using City equipment and supervisory personnel and if it were necessary
to pay the assumed	of construction by contract, it would be difficult, it not

impossible, to proceed with the project or pay the cost thereof by any greater assess-
ment against the property affected.

Vote was Commissioners Down, Krause, Marble and Perry and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting recessed and ad-
journed until Thursday the 19th day of November, 1936 at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

LAS VEGAS, CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.
NOVEMBER 23rd, 1936.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las
Vegas held on the 23rd day of November, 1936 at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

Roll call showed the following present, Mayor Arnett, Commissioners Down, Krause, and

A letter from A.R.Tipton, of Boulder City asking permission to bring into the City of
Las Vegas about fifty (50) houses from Boulder City, was read to the Board.

Said letter was referred to C.D. Baker, City Building Inspector for investigation and report.

On motion of Commissioner Marble seconded by Commissioner Down it was moved and carried
that the following order of the Board of Commissioners be issued:

ORDER OF THE BOARD______

It heretofore appearing to the Board that it was necessary, convenient, beneficial and
advisable to made certain improvements upon the City streets and within the area as herein
after described, and it further appearing that the Board heretofore ordered the City Engineer
to prepare and file with the City Clerk plats, diagrams and estimates of expense of such im-
provements for public examination, and it further appearing that thereafter notice was given
by publication and posting for the time and in the manner as required by the City Charter of
the time when the Board would meet and consider any suggestions and objections by parties in
interest of the proposed improvements, and it further appearing that the said time was set for
the 23rd day of November, 1936, ay the hour of seven o'clock P.M. of the said day at the City
Hall in the City of Las Vegas, and it further appearing that the owners of more than one-half
of the frontage be be assessed have not filed written or any objections thereto, it is therefore

ORDERED by the Board that the improvements upon the streets and the area described in the
said notice to be made; that is to say the following described streets within the city, to-wit:
All of Sixth Street from Linden Avenue to and including its southern most end; All of
Seventh Street from its north end where it intersects with the Union Pacific Railroad
grounds, south to and including Garces Street; all of Eighth Street from Mesquite Avenue
to and including Clark Street; all of Ninth Street from Stewart to Fremont Street; all
of Tenth Street from Ogden to Fremont Street; all of Eleventh Street from from Ogden to
Fremont Street; All of Linden Avenue from Sixth Street to to Seventh Street; all of
Mesquite Avenue from Fifth Street to Eighth Street; all of Stewart Avenue from Fifth
Street to Ninth Street; all of Ogden Street from the a ley between Fifth and Sixth
Streets to Ninth Street; all of Carson Street from Fifth Street to Eighth Street; all of
Bridger Street from Fifth Street to Eighth Street; all of Lewis Street from Fifth Street
to Seventh Street; all of Clark Street from Fifth Street to Eighth Street; all of Bonne-
ville Street from Fifth Street to Seventh Street; all of Charleston Boulevard from
Fifth Street to Seventh Street; all of Garces Street from Fifth Street to Seventh Street;
all of Division Street from Fifth Street to Sixth Street; all of Fifth Place.
to be improved with oil bound gravel pavement and concrete curbs and gutters, excepting such
portion thereof as may now contain both oil bound gravel or concrete pavement and concrete curbs
and gutters, and it is further

ORDERED that the expense thereof be paid approximately fifth-five percent (55%) thereof
from revenues to be derived from special assessments upon the lots and parcels of land abutting
upon and adjacent to the said streets according to benefits, and approximately forty-five (45%)
thereof to be paid from a special fund to be granted by the United States Government for that
purpose, and it is further

ORDERED that the said district so above described shall be known as and call "The Las
Vegas 1937 Improvement District Number 3".

Vote on the above order was Commissioners Down, Krause and Marble and His Honor the
Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

Minutes of a Special Meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas,

Held on the 15th day of December, 1936.

Roll call showed the following present, Mayor Arnett, Commissioners Down, Krause, Marble
and Perry City Clerk and Attorney.

On motion of Commissioner Down seconded by Commissioner Perry the following Resolution
was Introduced and passed:

WHEREAS the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas has heretofore and on the
fourth day of December, 1936, declared its intention to annex certain portions of the territory
adjacent to the City of Las Vegas, more fully described in said Resolution and Declaration, and

WHEREAS the town of North Las Vegas was included within the area so proposed to be annexed

and

WHEREAS it has been brought to the attention of the Board that to so annex the said area
comprosing the town of North Las Vegas might probably complicate and interfere with the town's
proposed water project now, as we are advised, in the progress of completion, it is therefore,
RESOLVED and ORDERED that all proceedings heretofore taken by the Board of Commissioners
of the City of Las Vegas to the end of annexing the said territory in the said Resolution
and Declaration described, be, and the same hereby is, rescinded, and it it further

ORDERED that all proceedings looking to the annexation of the said territory be, and the
same hereby is, abandoned.

Vote was Commissioners Down, Krause, Marble and Perry and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes, none.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting adjourned.

DECEMBER 30th, 1936.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas,
held on the 30th day of December, 1936 at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

Roll call showed the following present Mayor Arnett, Commissioners Krause, Down and Marble,
City Attorney and City Clerk.

Absent Commissioner Perry
In attendance at this time were the Clark County Delegates to the State Legislature.

Frank Ryan, Senator, and R.T. Moore, Berkeley Bunker, James Farnsworth Assemblymen.
Mr. Cline, Assemblyman was not in attendance.

Mr. Farnsdale informed the Board that he was heartily in favor of municipal ownership,
especially municipal power and would do all in his power to help the City secure municipal
owner ship.

Mr. Bunker informed that Board that his platform as sent forth during the election in the
fall was unchanged but refused to quote the flatform he used during the election, and also stated
he was not going to commit himself on the way in which he would vote on questions pertaining
to the City of Las Vegas the County of Clark of the State of Nevada. That the stand he would
take during the legislature would depend on the presentation of the various bills, and the
manner in which they were presented. He referred especially to Charter amendments of the City
and not committing himself until such time as the same might be presented to the State Leg-
islature, and his vote on the same at the time introduced in legislature would depend on the
wording of the same.

Mr. Moore and Mr. Ryan informed the Board that they had no statement to make at this time
but might at a meeting to be held on January 4th, 1937. Mr. Moore ask that he be handed a draft
of any acts or bills that the City might want introduced.

Mr. Taylor, City Attorney sketched the outline of the City's fight for municipal power
ownership.

On motion of Commissioner Marble seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried
that the Mayor and Clerk sign sales agreements with the Mohawk Oil and Texas oil companies for
requirements for the year 1937.

Vote was Commissioners Down, Krause and Marble and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, non

Las Vegas, Nevada,

January 2, 1937.

Mrs. Fannie Ryan,

Las Vegas, Nevada.

Dear Mrs. Ryan;

This is in answer to your communication of December 2, 1936, addressed to the
Board of City Commissioners, with respect to certain lots and property on and about Block
16, wherein it is alleged that prostitution is being suffered to exist.

The Board takes this opportunity to thank you for calling this matter to its attention.

You are advised that the Chief of Police has been directed by the Board to zealously
suppress any and all existing institutions of prostitution and to use all means at his com-
mand to prevent recurrences of similar conditions.

Very respectfully

BY ORDER OF THE BOARD OF
COMMISSIONERS OF THE CITY
OF LAS VEGAS

VIOLA BURNS_______

City Clerk.

was adopted:

IT IS ORDERED that so much of that certain Resolution and Order made and adopted by
the Board on the 15th day of June, 1933, as reads as follows:

"Four taxi stand is the limit allowed on Fremont Street with length of twenty
(20) feet for each car stand. Taxi drivers to get permission form property
owners for stand and to paint and maintain own stands.",
be, and the same hereby is, set aside and revoked.

Vote was Commissioners Down, Krause, Marble and Perry and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.
Noes; none.

JANUARY 8th, 1937.

Minutes of a recessed regular meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas,
held on the 8th day of January 1937 at the hour of seven O'clock P.M.

Roll call showed the following present, Mayor Arnett, Commissioners Down, Krause and Marble,

City Clark and City Attorney.

Absent Commissioner Perry.

Mr. Platt of the Nevada Horticultural Association appeared before the Board in regard to the
planting of additional trees and shrubs in the City Park.

No definite action was taken on this matter at this time.

A.H. Harrington appeared before the Board in regard to insurance for city owned property.

On motion of Commissioner Marble seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried that
the letter from the insurance company Mr. Harrington represented be handed to City Attorney
Taylor for investigation.

Vote was Commissioners Down, Krause and Marble and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

Mr. Hampton, Mr. Worswick and Mr. Blackman, of the Board of Appraisal presented to the Board
a report of its findings in regard to the value of the City buildings as same may be consid-
ered for insurance.

On motion of Commissioner Marble seconded by Commissioner Down it was moved and carried that
the Board of City Commissioners accept the report of the Board of Appraisal and that the
said Board be dismissed with a vote of thanks.

Vote was Commissioners Down, Krause and Marble and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

The reports, both written and pictorial to be permanent records and to be filed in the office
of the City Clerk.

On motion of Commissioner Down seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried that
all slot machine license applications presented to the Board at this time be granted. All appli-
cations being in proper order and money on file with + he clerk to cover the same.

Vote was Commissioners Down, Krause and Marble and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Down seconded by Commissioner Krause the following retail beverage
licenses for the year 1937 were granted:

Sophis Noon, Thos. L. Adams, E.F. Noon, Blaine Johnson, G. Lopez, Sam Mikulich, W.R.Van Eaton,
W.C.Schultz, Jake Ensley

Vote was Commissioner Down, Krause and Marble and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Down, seconded by Commissioner Krause it was moved and carried that
the Clark County Wholesale Mercantile Co. Inc. be granted a wholesale beverage license for the
year 1937.

Vote was Commissioners Down, Krause and Marble and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes, none.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting recessed and adjourned
until 20th day of January, 1937 at the hour of seven o'clock P.M.

Min tes of a special meeting of the Board of Commissioners of the City of Las Vegas, held on
the 9th day of January 1937 at the hour of eleven o'clock A.M.

The following answered roll call, Mayor Arnett, Commissioners Down, Krause, Marble and Perry,

City Attorney and Clerk.

This meeting being called for the purpose of transacting business in connection with the Las
Vegas Improvement Project No. 3 the Board at once entered upon the business at hand.

motion of Commissioner Marble seconded by Commissioner Down it was moved and carried that
the maps and plans for Las Vegas Improvement District No. 3. be approved and filed with the
City Clerk.

Vote was Commissioners Down, Krause, Marble, and Perry and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes,
none.

On motion of Commissioner Marble, seconded by Commissioner Perry it was moved and carried that
the Mayor L.L. Arnett forward a telegram in the following form to W.L. Felt, Acting State
Director W.P.A. Reno, Nevada.

"Retel even date assessment payment period ends March tenth bond issue can be authorized im-
mediately thereafter after bonds issued thirty days notice of sale required committment for
purchase of bonds cannot be definitely made until after advertisement many persons soliciting
opportunity to buy bonds city can legally and will transfer its proportion of funds which
amounts to approximately twelve thousand dollars from general fund to prosecute work until
assessment bond funds available final plans and specifications will be ready to submit as soon
as it is determined whether we proceed force account or contract.

L.L. Arnett Mayor.

Vote was Commissioners Down, Krause, Marble and Perry and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.

Noes, none.

The Clerk was Directed to forward the following telegram to Wright L. Felt, Reno, WPA
Director for the State;

With reference to Las Vegas City Street project city is prepared and intends to start work

on eleventh agreeably with terms of governments offer of October twenty third and citys acceptance
of November fourth money available to start project and we request your definite permission
to start the project on January eleventh in all events work will start January eleventh
and will continue in conformance with agreement with government.

By Order of the Board of Commissioners of the City of
Las Vegas, Viola Burns, City Clerk
On motion of Commissioner Down Seconded by Commissioner Marble the following order was
issued:

IT IS ORDERED that on January 11, 1937, work be commenced on "Las Vegas 1937 Improvement
District #3" and that the same be continued in conformity with the agreement now existing be-
tween the City and the United States Government relating to the said improvement district

and C.D.Baker, the City Engineer, is hereby directed to commence the said work for and on
behalf of the City.

Vote was Commissioners Down, Krause, Marble and Perry and His Honor the Mayor voting aye. Noes,
none.

On motion of	Commissioner Marble seconded by Commissioner Krause	it was

RESOLVED:	That the United	States Government, through the Federal	Emergency	Administrator	of

Public Works, be and it hereby is requested to extend the time for the commencement of work
upon the Las Vegas Street Improvement District being designated as Nevada 1021-R, until the

first day of February, 1937.

And it is ordered: That a copy of this Resolution be for with transmitted to the State Administrator
 by wire.

Vote Was Commissioners Down, Krause, Marble and Perry voting aye. Noes, none.

On motion	of	Commissioner	Perry seconded by Commissioner Marble

IT IS HEREBY	ORDERED that Five Thousand Dollars ($5,000.00) be transferred from the	General

Fund of the City of Las Vegas to "Las Vegas 1937 Improvement District Fund No. 3", the gen-
eral Fund of the City of Las Vegas to be reimbursed to the extend of such amount as soon
as said improvement funds shall be in condition to permit the transfer back to the General
Fund.

Vote was Commissioners Down, Krause, Marble and Perry and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.

Noes, none.

On motion of Commissioner Perry seconded by Commissioner Marble it was moved and carried that
C.D. Baker, City Engineer: Ryland Taylor, City Attorney; and a member of the Board of Com-
missioners go to Reno and appear before the State Director of the W.P.A. in regard to the
Las Vegas Improvement District #3 project. Expenses of the trip to be stood by the City of Las
Vegas.

Vote was Commissioners Down, Krause, Marble and Perry and His Honor the Mayor voting aye.

Noes, none.

No further business appearing before the Board at this time the meeting adjourned.

NOTICE IS HEREBY GIVEN: That the City of Las Vegas, Nevada, proposes to make certain im-
provements, to-wit: Constructing oil bound gravel pavement and concrete curbs and gutters upon

be seen and examined at the office of the City Clerk in the City Hall in the City of Las Vegas,
and copies may be obtained by the payment of the sum of fifteen Dollars ($15.00) therefor.

of said bids.

This being the day heretofore set by the Board as the time when objections would be heard

district No. 3" assessments, it having convened at 9 A.M. and remained in session from that time

with the assessor, and no objections having been made or suggestions offered it was on motion
of Commissioner Down, seconded by Commissioner Krause ordered:

"Las Vegas 1937 Improvement District No. 3" be, and the same hereby is approved and confirmed and
the assessments therein contained and enumerated are hereby adopted.

Upon motion of Commissioner Marble seconded by Commissioner Down it was moved and car-
ried that the City send the following answer to the Building Trades Council and that the
